I have ordered multiple items from them, however, a piece of the order was missing so I filed a complaint.After a month, I received no response, so I chased this up. Initially, they claimed they could no longer claim and I quote "Unfortunately, due to the age of this order, reliable tracking information is no longer available. Because of this, we won't be able to provide a replacement or refund for this order at this time.".Obviously, I wasn't happy with this irresponsible response in which they ended up chasing up for me and asking for more information AGAIN despite having provided the information a month ago.After a while they replied me with this: "Based on our investigation and your statements, it seems that the item has been stolen by a third party and we urge you to contact your local police department to report the theft of the parcel. To assist in obtaining a Police Report , we recommend that you provide a copy of the email that we will send to you to the police to help explain what has happened. We'll happily cooperate with the police as part of any investigation.If the issue isn't resolved after contacting local law enforcement and the carrier, please contact us back during the business hours of the related police department with a link to access your Police Report , or a PDF/Image file of the Police Report. There are multiple ways to file a Police Report. Check with your local authorities for ways to file a report. Note that we will not be able to offer support on this delivery after 1-July-2024. Please ensure to get a Police Report and contact back before this time."The item missing is about 100 USD and anyone would know how useless it is to contact police without any solid evidence provided such as a packing video from Amazon part to show they have actually packed the correct number or items. Let alone wasting 5-6 hours (ie. 1 working) day just to chase up something worth 100 USD, I might as well work a minimum wage for that.Anyway, this is very irresponsible from Amazon part and let me leave this message here for good.Do not order too many pieces with Amazon or else you might ended up wasting hundreds of dollars for nothing.For Amazon: If you're reading this, my order number is 111-7515587-0251454

Here's a review of a product that I wrote on Amazon, but for some reason it keeps being unsubmitted. So, I came here. "This product arrived on time and was wonderful the first time that we ordered it. We decided to purchase another. The problem is that the zipper is broken and the fabric is torn. It makes the seat look used instead of brand new.UPDATE:Someone came over to pick up the item before I had a chance to check my email and/or the message left on Amazon website.  I have to work. The guy came to the door, said he could not wait, as his supervisor was with him. He was impatient, maybe stressed because of the supervisor and not exactly polite. (I'm glad he has a job and want him to continue to work, but customer service is a positive thing.)Baseline: He could not take the package as it was not ready. He left a slip and said he'd be back tomorrow. It has to be in the box that it came in.I am 67 years old. I remember when we could return items whether we had the box that we bought them in or not. We were still able to get our money back. I paid for it. It is damaged. I want my money. I don't care. They should be able to take it whether or not it is in the same package.Also, if does not fit. Ironically, because of the damage, ie the zipper does not work, I am able to fit small pieces into the opening left when it is unzipped. I was not able to fix the section with the wheels in the pox though. I had no one to help me at the time and had to pull the wheels off to be more versatile. It took almost tow hours. I could not wait for help, as I have to have it ready. I'm not sure when he will come. I was almost able to fit everything in properly, but the top is unable to close, as some parts stick out.I was finally able to read the massage on Amazon. I can drop it off if it is not picked up. I don't drive. That's one reason why I order online. I have to wait for someone to pick it up for me and I have a deadline to get it back.First, they received their money with no problem. I fulfilled my end of the bargain ASAP. Yet,  I had to wait for them to ship it at their convivence. Now, that i need my money back, through no fault of my own, I can't have it back ASAP, I again have to wait and follow their guidelines to have a refund. Needless guidelines, as returns were previously made whether they fit in the original box or not. I understand that I have to wait for shipments and my refund, but it has to fit in the box? For real? Provide bigger boxes.And, what if I had thrown the box away? I don't have space to keep original boxes.Secondly, I was unable to work during the time that I tried to package it. If we go to court, I want to be reimbursed for the time that I lost. My money was not damaged. Their product was.Thirdly, I have a deadline, I have to get it back ASAP. I will either have to carry this item via bus. It's heavy. or, take an Uber, which is expensive and I want to be reimbursed either way for cost of transportation and my time. I may be able to have one of my sons transport me on their day off and/or after work. It was convenient to have it picked up. I deserve it. They got my undamaged money on time.I wanted to have them replace the seat, which would have been easy for me. The guy could have brought one. It was their decision to return the whole chair. They should make sure that they get it and I get either my money or a exchange.UPDATE:I went back to read instructions on Amazon again. It did not specify that it needed the original box, but did say that it had to be securely packaged. It is, as far as I am concerned. It fits in the box, although it is not sealed and items stick out of it. He can take it to UPS, they will package it and send it back. They did it when I returned an item for Spectrum. Why does it have to be me? He's picking it up anyway. They will do it no matter who brings it. Why me and not him?

I've been purchasing on Amazon for years (like many others do).Several years ago, my account was hacked and purchases were made on my account. I was told, it would still be available to me however, I was never able to access the information anywhere.I was then prohibited from posting reviews on my purchases. Amazon claimed due to previous reviews, I was banned from ever submitting reviews again.I don't recall ever posting reviews that would warrant being banned. I made multiple requests for them to tell me what was submitted that caused me to be banned however, Amazon never responded.Now, I'm noticing, each time, I place an order, the delivery time takes longer and longer.I don't think it has anything to do with the above mentioned matters. I think it's Amazon's attempt to get me to join Amazon Prime. I never took issue with the amount of time it took to receive items however, now the wait time is 2+ weeks to receive deliveries. I placed an order the third week of July and the deluvery window for seven items is listed between Sept 7-12. Six weeks for delivery? Uncertain if Amazon is tightening their belts and making non-Prime members pay the price or the quality of Amazon's business practices are is diminishing which eventually happens to many organizations.I began searching other online business to see if I can find better prices etc....I never used to question Amazon's integrity however, there seems to be a bit of a snowball effect which is causing me to question things and stray..... I purchase a ton of stuff from Amazon yet, they ban me from leaving reviews and take literally several weeks to deliver items? Then they aren't even capable of protecting my account from being hacked, items I never purchased but, they chose to disregard the issue?

Amazon makes sure a customer can't get in touch when they claim that a delivery has been made to my door or to the porch. First problem: there's no porch. Second problem and the reason for my complaint: THERE'S NO SIGN OF A DELIVERY OF ANY SORT ANYWHERE TO BE FOUND!!! And Amazon makes sure that I will never get it!!! I have given the most explicit instructions; maybe I have to draw a photo map as well?!?!?!? Now I worry that all the orders I place are going to be left just anywhere and I'll just pay for things that I'll never receive. I notice that direct interaction is not possible. Some possibility of making contact with a human being should be available; when no possibility is made available, ripping off a customer is child's play. If I have to go out and lead the delivery person by the hand to get to my door, TELL ME SO IN PLAIN ENGLISH, A LANGUAGE IN WHICH I HAVE WRITTEN AND PUBLISHED!!! Amazon has a publication of mine on record, so they can't say my instructions aren't clear. What burns me most is the lying. Delivery was not made. The app gives me no way to make contact. Maybe they assume I'll die before a delivery is made. I give up. I have no way of guessing anymore. If Walmart made a delivery to my door, Amazon should have been able to do the same thing -- maybe. I have a legal right to cancel in the 14 days cooling off period under distance selling regulations. I cancelled the ¬£620 purchase of an O2 SIM from a 3rd party seller when I found it did not work in my area - contrary to what their website says - but the seller would not cancel. I cancelled on the advice of O2 where, after several attempts to check the SIM activation over the phone with O2 who could not find or access it, I took it into an O2 store who advised me to cancel it as that SIM and Mobile Broadband does not work where I live. I had checked the coverage checker before I bought it but was told that was the anticipated coverage after the upgrade was rolled out, their internal map told a different story. I cancelled it there and then while I was in store. My only option is a wired connection which I have now bought. I then contacted Amazon.co.uk 8 days ago under the A-Z Guarantee thinking this was a crystal clear case of cancelling in the cooling off period. I cancelled in the cooling off period in writing. It is in Amazon messages. What is there to argue about. Give me my refund. But no. I find that they say the decision is 7 days. THEN, if you add any details or chase because it is a simple case, THEY RESTART THE 7-DAY CLOCK. We are now on day 8 and as I chased/added proof, it will now be a minimum of 15 days until a decision and I cant chase before as it will restart the clock. Why will it take 15 days to 'decide' whether I can have my ¬£620 back when the service does not work and I cancelled in the cooling off period. Even when I put in the claim over the phone, it was not actually filed the first time. I am not sure if this is deliberate to get rid of the semi-serious claimants but after I did not get an email confirming my ¬£620 refund, I called again and found it had never been filed. i was told not to worry the second time, but then got a huge email requiring me to report this as a theft to the police and it went on and on. It seems the claim that was filed was filed incorrectly on my behalf saying i had not received it, then someone at Amazon took the agent's  filing as the version to work from and out of the blue introduced that looking at my messages about cancelling in the cooling off period and the agents filing, the item must have been stolen, and then proceeded to design a prolonged and convoluted way forward which involved reporting to the police and uploading the reports and it went on and on. This is just to delay the inevitable - whether I have to take Amazon or the seller to court as it was Amazon I found and used the seller from, and Amazon's A-Z guarantee that gives you false commitment to safety of your purchase. They are ACTUALLY trying to get the seller to keep my ¬£620 for providing something that does not work and something I cancelled in the cooling off period in writing through their system so they can see. The A-Z Guarantee is not actually a guarantee that your money is safe. This is causing me so much stress. My mother has just died and I cant even communicated about her funeral service without getting dressed and driving for miles to get to an area I can use the internet. I sent them proof I have bought into a full fibre wired connection now as that is the only thing that will work. Still no response. I want to upload a no internet screenshot I took from home but funnily enough, I cant. Do not trust the A-Z Guarantee. Youl could not have a more straightforward case than mine. The service provider themselves told me to cancel as it would not work, I am in the cooling off period, and here we are 8 days later with no expected decision for another week. It is so stressful not to be able to chase or ask without the clock resetting. It is very manipulative and not at ALL cusomer 'service'.

The Hyundai 1700w Pressure Washer I bought from Amazon failed to switch on just one year after purchase and just a few weeks after last using it.It came with a generous 3 yr Warranty (no need to register, just proof of purchase)So i emailed the Genpower Group Customer Services with a copy of my Amazon order and after a few cursory questions, they offered a replacement without needing it returnedWhen I queried a delay in confirming dispatch, they apologised that this model was currently Out of Stock in their warehouse.So I asked them for a refund instead which they apologised could only be given by Amazon.I was in the middle of a ‚ÄòChat‚Äô conversation with Amazon who indicated that in the circumstances, they would give me a refund when Genpower rang back, offering me an upgraded (1900w) replacement.They dispatched it next day with a one day delivery and as you would expect I was delighted with the improved features and xtra power which helped recover the delay in being able to use  a pressure washerSo apart from the premature failure of the original 1700w product, I have nothing but thanks and praise for the manner in which both Hyundai (Genpower) and Amazon have handled my disappointment Hence a 5 Star review to both of them

Just like others, we traditionally have great experiences ordering from Amazon; however, when we wrote a review about their sales/shipping practices, Amazon refused to post it, citing "doesn't meet community guidelines." The only part of the review Amazon could be referring to, is that we indicated that Amazon permits sellers to charge shipping fees for a product that Amazon warehouses ship for free - let me clarify that. If the seller has product in stock, "they" ship it and charge a delivery fee. If they do not have it in stock, but Amazon has it in their warehouse, Amazon ships it directly, with no delivery fee added. Yeah, that sounds totally backwards, but that was the information we received from Amazon Customer Service. We stated in our review that this is not a "customer first" approach, because Amazon does not clearly notify the buyer about this practice. I guess Amazon does not like "truths" being posted within reviews on their own website. Amazon used to be the best "big business" company for customer service, but they have slowly and steadily become a "money first" entity. Need more proof? Enjoy the ads through Prime Video.

I recently ordered several items from Amazon, to be delivered by Evri.  The items were due to be delivered a few days ago, then I got a message from Evri saying that they tried to deliver but couldn't because access to our house was blocked.  This was untrue.  I was at home all day and no delivery van appeared, and the access to our house is always clear.  I looked on my Amazon order page, and it advised me to contact Evri.  I really tried to do this.  There is no option on Evri's site to speak to a human being, so I left a message on their chatbot explaining the problem.  They didn't reply, but instead left me a message saying they had tried to deliver again and still couldn't.  This is nonsense.  Whoever they are trying to deliver to, it's not to our address.  On my Amazon account it now says that Evri have paused the delivery until I contact them with more information.  What information?! And how am I supposed to do this, when they won't talk to me?!!Instead I contacted Amazon customer service and asked for a refund for the items.  The agent told me that they couldn't request a refund until the following day, so he would phone me back today.  Today he sent me an email saying he can't get through on my number, I don't know why, and that I need to call Amazon back.  I did this, and the line was so bad I could barely hear the lady I was trying to explain the problem to.  She said she would process a refund.  Later I looked at my Amazon account to check the status of the items, and there was no change, so I phoned back to check that the refund had been requested.  I was told that it hadn't, and that it will be done now and will be in my bank account next week. After all the problems, I have little faith that it will happen.  I have wasted hours trying to resolve this and I am at my wit's end.  It is absurd and not good enough.  I buy a lot from Amazon, but this has put me off and from now on I will shop locally whenever possible.
The order I placed never arrived and requesting a refund on Amazon is the most frustrating experience ever. I will place all of my orders elsewhere from now on

On 5/17/24, I picked up my order for Prevagen brain supplement. The product was packaged inside a sturdy cardboard box that had the safety seal broken. There was a red sticked on the box that stated, "The box clearly states that "This is a set. DO NOT SEPARATE". Obviously, the box has been tampered with, and 2 bottles of the product have been removed. The bottle had no safety seal at all, and there is no way that I am using this product. I looked online, and there are many more reviews that state the same thing. Amazon customer service gave me a refund, but I wanted to post the review to warn other customers of the tampering issue. Guess what? My review doesn't meet community standards! Amazon doesn't want any reviews to pertain to the seller, which is ridiculous, since the package was tampered with, the safety seal on the outside of the box had been slit open, the package had originally contained 3 bottles, not just one, and the worst, the bottle itself had no safety seal, and someone had access to the supplements before shipping. Great idea, Amazon. Don't have any reviews that warn a customer of potential safety issues on a product. Better that you make additional sales, which may cover your legal issues if the product is not Prevagen!

I had a very bad experience with Amazon.deI ordered multiple pairs of Falke socks in the promotion in different colours. Since you could only order 4 pair of any colour at the same time, I also placed multiple orders.On the Amazon website it stated that these socks were all to be delivered within a week or maximum 14 days to the Netherlands.I received the largest part of my orders within 14 days, however Amazon could not ship 8 pair of socks at that time and I was given an indication of another 2-3 weeks for delivery.After waiting patiently for these socks for 3 weeks, I received a message from Amazon (the day before these socks were set to be shipped) that they were cancelling the order.I contacted the Amazon helpdesk to ask what happened. They told me the colour could not be found in the warehouse and therefore they would cancel my order. I asked them if it would be possible to get a different colour (at the time of ordering multiple other colours were also available for the promotional price).After some discussion Amazon agreed to sell me 8 pair of socks in a colour of my choice. They even promissed me an additional discount of 10% and refund of the shipping costs because of all the hassle.They told me I had to cancel my orders and order these socks at the current price. They would than refund me the difference in price once I received the orders, as well as the 10% discount and the shipping costs.To make sure I understood correctly I even send them a calculation of what refund the would be giving me (the price was more than double compared to the promotional price). They confirmed I understood everything correctly and I wouldn't have to worry.So I ordered 8 pair of socks and send Amazon an message to receive the refund. However, Amazon refused to give me the promised refund.I have had long message conversations as well as 2 phone calls for over an hour with the help desk. During these calls the Amazon employees agreed with me and promised me to arrange the refund. Afterwards I got written messages that I have been misinformed and that they can't/won't give me the refund.Finally, I have returned the 8 pair of socks to get my money back. It was impossible to get Amazon to keep their word and you should be aware that the promises they make mean nothing.
Amazon is an amazing website with instant shopping items and often have low price tags on amazing things.

I have been an Amazon Prime member for well over a decade and a Music + Member for several years. In my opinion, they were once a good company (I remember when they were a book seller!). Over the past few years, their service has detiorated drastically, in every way possible. I firmly believe that Walmart, Target or Home Depot are better options, depending on your needs. For your pet supplies, Chewy also offers 5% off on Subscribe & Save and they are a MUCH more personable company.  Streaming music is available from so many different companies and several are compatible with Amazon Echo devices, so there's no problem there. It seems as though Bezos got the money he needed and is now resting on his laurels. I could could go into the vast number of problems that now exist with the company, but it would take days and most people are probably already aware. I'm starting to feel like I am always on the phone with a representative who "can't help", but will escalate my case, which of course, means you will never hear from them again. They believe if they offer you a $5 credit for your "inconvenience", everything will be fine. It's demeaning, condescending and insulting. I'm all for capitalism, but, in my opinion, supporting Amazon's continuously and drastically worsening business practices, is an enormous mistake.

User-Friendly Interface and Vast SelectionOne of the most commendable features of Amazon.com is its user-friendly interface, which facilitates an effortless browsing and shopping experience. The website is well-organized, making it easy to find products among the countless categories and subcategories. Moreover, the vast selection of goods ensures that one can almost certainly find whatever item they are searching for, ranging from everyday essentials to specialized gadgets.Reliable and Fast ShippingAmazon's shipping services are exceptional. With Amazon Prime, users can enjoy the benefit of fast, free delivery on numerous items. In several instances, products arrive even sooner than promised, showcasing Amazon's commitment to reliability and customer satisfaction. This efficiency is particularly valuable for last-minute purchases or urgent needs.Competitive Pricing and DealsAmazon.com offers competitive pricing, frequently accompanied by deals, discounts, and promotions that enhance affordability. This pricing strategy, combined with an easy-to-use price comparison feature, empowers consumers to make informed purchasing decisions, ensuring they get great value on their buys.Customer-Centric Return PolicyThe return policy at Amazon is straightforward and customer-centric, designed to ensure that if you're not satisfied with a purchase, the process to initiate a return is simple and hassle-free. This policy, coupled with excellent customer service support, enhances the overall shopping experience, instilling a high level of trust and confidence in the platform.Secure and Safe TransactionsSecurity is paramount on Amazon.com, where transactions are secure and user data is protected with high levels of encryption. This commitment to security reassures customers, making them feel safe while shopping online.Robust Review SystemAmazon's customer review system is robust, providing prospective buyers with honest, detailed feedback from other users. This transparency aids customers in making more informed decisions about their purchases 4 6 .Innovative Features and TechnologyAmazon continually integrates the latest technology and innovative features into its platform, enhancing the shopping experience. Features such as Alexa shopping, one-click purchasing, and personalized recommendations make shopping seamless and more enjoyable.ConclusionOverall, Amazon.com stands out as a leading e-commerce platform due to its comprehensive approach to online retail, which includes a vast selection of products, competitive pricing, fast and reliable deliveries, and a customer-focused service ethos. Its continuous innovation and commitment to customer satisfaction rightfully earn it a 5-star rating.

VIOLATIONS OF FEDERAL FAIR TRADE COMPETITION LAW The FTC and states allege Amazon‚Äôs anticompetitive conduct occurs in two markets‚Äîthe online superstore market that serves shoppers and the market for online marketplace services purchased by sellers. These tactics include:Anti-discounting measures that punish sellers and deter other online retailers from offering prices lower than Amazon, keeping prices higher for products across the internet. For example, if Amazon discovers that a seller is offering lower-priced goods elsewhere, Amazon can bury discounting sellers so far down in Amazon‚Äôs search results that they become effectively invisible.Conditioning sellers‚Äô ability to obtain ‚ÄúPrime‚Äù eligibility for their products‚Äîa virtual necessity for doing business on Amazon‚Äîon sellers using Amazon‚Äôs costly fulfillment service, which has made it substantially more expensive for sellers on Amazon to also offer their products on other platforms. This unlawful coercion has in turn limited competitors‚Äô ability to effectively compete against Amazon.Amazon‚Äôs illegal, exclusionary conduct makes it impossible for competitors to gain a foothold. With its amassed power across both the online superstore market and online marketplace services market, Amazon extracts enormous monopoly rents from everyone within its reach.

There seem to be two weights and measures for setting up shop with Amazon.com. One for the local (read: American) people and one for the international (read: Chinese) sellers.I recently helped someone local setting up an Amazon Seller‚Äôs Account. What a tedious, strenuous experience. Lots of documents and information required: driver license, proof of residency, bank and credit card details, business address, description and references, verified phone numbers and email addresses, name of business owners, company representative, nationality, etc‚Ä¶etc‚Ä¶etc‚Ä¶I understand, Amazon is protecting its brand and wants to weed out bogus operations to protect itself and sellers, right?Well, I got a big surprise when I had to contact Amazon concerning a failing product sold by a third party vendor (read: Chinese).(1) impossible to contact the seller directly, no information about the seller is listed. Only the name is provided (let‚Äôs say ABC)(2) contacting the seller is only possible through the Messaging Assistant who states: ‚ÄúI send your message to ABC‚Äù. Since no response from seller is received, I contacted Customer Service Support for help getting in contact with the vendor directly.And here it gets juicy. The Agent also did not find any contact information about seller ABC. Agent escalated the question higher up to a Lead Agent who came back empty handed. No information is available about company ABC.How is that possible? Since I experienced personally how though the vetting procedure is to set up shop on the Amazon platform and all the verified contact details that needed to be provided before a sellers account can be opened, here is a third party vendor (read: Chinese) company ABC selling on the Amazon website and nobody knows how to get in contact with them.In the meantime and that because of the staggering complains about their faulty product(s), company ABC changed its name into XYZ apparently without any scrutiny by Amazon. That way, company XYZ does not need to reply to complains about products it did not sell. They keep selling same unsound products using same templates on the Amazon portal. It‚Äôs obvious that the screening by Amazon is non-existing. Corporate greed towers above buyer‚Äôs protection. Permission is given to Chinese companies who can distribute their cheaper but faulty products to us and unaware Americans are left behind holding the bag. Time to wake up people! Buy local (read: American)!

Amazon probably provide my favourite shopping experience. Everything you want to know about your product is available to you from reviews, to dimensions, to Q&A, to comparisons with other products. They've been pretty good when I've had problems with things. I guess this exposes a flaw in Trustpilot as a platform. Amazon have so many customers and there is no motivation for customers to leave a positive review on the website, even though I'm sure the majority of customers would, however when you're angry you'll post a 1 star review everywhere you can. As a result the company with the best shopping experience has a sub 2-star review.

My nightmare with amazon customer service started off a few days before Christmas when I ordered a gift for my parents. A few days after placing the order, I checked my letterbox on my way back from work to find that my package from Amazon had been delivered to my neighbours, however, it was not specified which neighbours the package was delivered to. Bear in mind, I live in an apartment block with over 100 residents. So I put up a sign on the entrance asking if anyone has received my package to please contact me. I also contacted amazon asking them where my package is exactly. Consequently, Amazon launched an investigation with the courier and found that there is no further information as to where the package was delivered and as a result starts a refund process. So far so good. However, after waiting for more than a full week, I still did not receive my refund and there are no further updates from Amazon. Therefore, I called customer service, spelled out my unbelievably long university email about 3 times before they got it right for them to check what the refund status was. They then assured me that all is in order and that I will receive my money soon. Nevertheless, days passed and I still did not receive a refund. So I decided to call again. After giving the customer service worker all my details they told me that my account had been blocked due to an outstanding payment on Amazon.es, although I live in Germany and order from Amazon.de. Therefore, the refund has also been blocked. As a result, they escalated the issue and promised me that I would receive my money as this outstanding order nonsense made no sense. Nevertheless, a week went by and my bank account was still 160 euros short. Consequently, I called a third time to ask what the situation was. Bear in mind, each time I call I have to explain my situation from the beginning and carry out the verification procedure of repeating my long and complex email address and home address. After explaining my situation, customer service once again told me that they have made a mistake and that my refund will be issued. Nevertheless, the EXACT same thing happened as last time. I didn't hear back from them for days and my refund never arrived. At this point I am 3 calls and several emails in with absolutely no progress.Subsequently, I called a fourth time to figure out what the hell was going on. This time I was forwarded to someone higher up in the customer service rankings. After almost one hour on the phone, the lady assured me that she would tend to the issue herself. Once this has been done, she would call me back with the final outcome. It was already 630 pm after work when the call was coming to an end. Nevertheless, she told me that she was working until midnight and would call me back before then. So I literally stayed awake until midnight waiting for a call which never arrived. Unacceptable Product Recall - Natures Aid DHA Drops (Amazon)I am writing this review to express my outrage at a recent product recall from Amazon. In July of last year, I purchased Natures Aid DHA Omega-3 Mini Drops for Infants and Children. Just this week, I received an email stating the product has been recalled due to containing hazardous chemicals!Here's the most disturbing part - my son, who was 19 months old at the time, consumed these drops! Amazon offered a simple refund as compensation. This is absolutely absurd! A refund does not come close to addressing the potential health risks my child may have faced.I am utterly disgusted that Amazon considers a measly ¬£5 sufficient compensation for potentially exposing my child to harmful chemicals. Their response is shockingly dismissive of a very serious situation.This experience raises serious concerns about the safety of products sold on Amazon and their handling of product recalls. Parents trust them with the well-being of their children, and this kind of nonchalant response is completely unacceptable.Other parents, please be aware! Check your cupboards for these recalled drops and take immediate action to protect your child's health. Furthermore, I urge Amazon to take product safety and recalls much more seriously. A simple refund is not enough when a child's health is potentially at risk.

Amazon customer service is the worst I‚Äôve ever experienced, or, I should say, has become that. This year marks the worst so far, and it‚Äôs only April. Nobody trains the agents what to do except lie, or they do not understand what you say to them. You can even water it down so anyone could understand it but they're always lost.¬†At the beginning of the year, I had to update my phone number. It took a month of working with the BBB to even attempt that. A billion agents each telling something asinine, thinking I‚Äôd believe it being they made constant assurances that never go anywhere. They are surely trained in that.I had to give them my blacked-out ID to merely update a bloody phone number that was easier with my bank, pharmacy and post office. After all, this whole country is based on phone numbers and codes when not involving targeted ads. The former is what finally after almost a month got my number updated after all their insanely ridiculous replies to the BBB case, which shows how dense and clueless they are. It sadly gets worse.That same month, I received two items damaged beyond repair. An agent two months ago said there was no need to return the item. I have screenshots. If you mention this, they seemingly panic and lie some more. Weirdly, there are screenshots, but the mere mention of such things sends them into a frenzy. The agents in turn assure more things which they never bothered to do, like a refund for one.¬†Two months later, I received  an email to return the item I was told to never send back. Screenshots tell the truth. They naturally took the money out after saying that if you‚Äôre charged, meaning you will be, we will reimburse you. They took it out twice.¬†¬†Another agent said he fixed it and issued it, but there was no confirmation email. More screenshots. Always take them, or they‚Äôll just lie some more. Of course, in essence it‚Äôs all they do when not assuring it is fixed and leads to more issues.¬†I thought to check if the refund even went through two days later, but I never received a confirmation email, so I merely engaged to check. An hour later, I was promised four months of free Prime because the other agent lied about issuing a refund just two days earlier.¬†I found out from the third agent during one chat alone (many get lost and transfer to another sometimes even more lost) for a simple issue (checking the status of non-existent and promised refunds). Amazon also conveniently and quite stupidly have no reference or ticket numbers for any chat so future agents won‚Äôt be as lost as they always are. Lovely.¬†This agent was as nice as most are, but clearly in over his head. I took billions of screenshots, but I am fearful all the promises will lead to more chats from hell. I know nobody wants to work there since Rocket Boy is so cheap; there‚Äôs nothing worse than the people working there. 2024 has already been an absolute nightmare. ¬†Always use chat so you can get screenshots of these fake promises. The emails have no reference numbers, as is now policy so ask for chat transcripts. Good luck in getting concrete answers for anything, as it‚Äôs all assurances to seem nice while they mislead you, or outright lie until you get the next lying agent. Fix this now, Rocket Boy.

I have mostly had good luck with Amazon over the years, but it's my most recent experiences that have me not "smiling".I recently ordered a new set of Sony surround speakers that were part of a renovation of what we call our "sunroom". When the "new" speakers arrived, one of the main tower speakers and the set of two Atmos ceiling-directed speakers were obvious returns. The tower speaker was without the soft foam "sock" that keeps it from being scratched and the Atmos speakers were carelessly wrapped in the soft foam (hanging half off) plus there were the remains of speaker wires being previously attached. I sent the tower speaker back to get another one and Amazon would only do a credit to the account and not a refund. I kept the Atmos speakers as they seem to work ok, but I felt cheated. These items should have been sold as "warehouse" items at a reduced price. New is new and not kind-of new and we pay a premium price for that privilege. The most recent problem was with a lightening arrester that I needed. I bought an item that would work with standard coax used by satellite and cable companies but received an item that was for larger coax. I sent it back for another one only to get the same wrong item. I'm now dealing directly with the producer of the item who is correcting the situation.After having the problem myself, I have since read where others have experienced the same problems. To add to the problem, Amazon has made it impossible to find and actual contact phone number where you can talk to a human to right things. If not for being able (at this point) to Google the number, I could not have talked to someone.These are some of the signs of a non customer-centric company.

I bought a pair of shoes, and I got a date when they should arrive. They did not arrive, and suddenly a new date was set, with a message they were delayed. This second date also passed, with no shoes and no further tracking info avaliable. I waited for a while, but then I reached out to customer serive by chat. I was told the item seemed to be lost or stolen along the way. I was asked to get new shoes. However, I was starting to be in a hurry for the date when I needed the shoes, and with normal delivery, I would not get them in time. I was then offered free express shipping. I was told i had to pay for it, but when the item arrived I was told to contact customer support again for a refund for the expenses of the express shipping. I was also told the chat would be stored so that i did not have to tell the whole story again. As this was promised to me, I aggreed to have the shoes sent another time, with express shipping. This time the item reached me as it was supposed to. I then contacted customer service again, but the person i got to talk to then, knew nothing about it. I had to explain everything all over again, and in the end I was told some other department or whatever had to handle it, and they would contact me within a day or so. I heard nothing from anyone after that. So now I tried again, as I am still missing the refund for the cost of the express shipping. I would not have bought the shoes otherwice, and at this point I would have been able to buy the shoes somewhere else for less. I was put in chat with first one person today, who sent me on to someone else in another department, that again left the chat so i had to start from scratch again with someone else for the 5th time. I can't begin to describe how far Amazon has fallen over the years.  I was a customer from the beginning.  I was with Prime shortly after it came out.  I seriously thought it was the best company in the world, until it wasn't.  Then it wasn't even close.  Amazon now has among the worst customer service I encounter anywhere.  It rivals Comcast and Verizon Fios for the worst service you can even conceive of.  There's literally no way to describe the thousand ways Amazon fails at basic stuff.  It's service is a nightmare now.  You're sent off to a foreign country, with people who are supremely unhelpful, with the simplest issues taking hours to resolve.  I'm over it.  I no longer trust Amazon.  It's that simple.  Most recent case in point: I called Synchrony Bank, the issuer of the Amazon store card, to pay my bill.  It said the balance was over $400, so I thought I'd go through to a live person and see what the purchases were, to make sure nothing was unauthorized.  I recognized every purchase, except one.  There was an $11 charge for Amazon digital services.  I knew I hadn't authorized any digital purchases, so told them to put me through to Amazon.  The Indian man I spoke with was completely unhelpful.  Mind you, I mean him or anyone else no disrespect for being foreign.  He spoke with a thick accent likely because English was his second language.  GOOD FOR HIM.  It's something to be proud of.  But it also makes it very difficult to take care of issues that have any degree of complexity at all. He insisted I definitely ordered Amazon Music Unlimited, because I played [unintelligible] on my Alexa device.  What was the name of it?  "It was [unintelligible]"  HUH?  SAY THAT AGAIN SLOWLY?  Literally, his accent was so thick I couldn't tell at all what he was saying.  After repeating it a fourth time, I made out the word "noise."  It hit me that Amazon was charging me $11 a month to play "brown noise" on my bedroom Alexa device.  I've played that as a background sleep noise for YEARS.  Didn't start in December.  I've literally played it for about 3-5 years, every single night.  Suddenly it apparently started charging me for it in December.  I never heard it ask me ANYTHING about a subscription and certainly never agreed to any such thing.  But that didn't convince this Amazon rep, who apparently could read my mind and insisted I absolutely did order it.  I grew increasingly annoyed, especially as he kept going silent for 20, 30, 40 seconds at a time without saying a word, no hold or anything.. just silence.  Finally I told him, "why are you being silent?  I don't know what you're doing."  He then hung up on me.  So much for customer service.  I called angrier now and spoke with a second rep.  She was so very sorry the first rep hung up on me.  If I would just take more time out of my Saturday night to explain everything all over again and verify myself again... which I had no choice but to do.  She took a complaint on the last rep, but said she couldn't help me.  I'd have to be transferred to Amazon music.  Mind you, by this time it's nearly 1 am in the morning on a Sunday morning.  She puts me on hold... and I wait and I wait and wait some more.  About 15 minutes she comes back and says "I'm sorry for the long wait.  I'm still in the queue to speak with Amazon music."  I told her I would wait.  She puts me back on hold... 20 minutes pass... 30 minutes pass... 40 minutes pass.  Finally I had to give up.  She never came back on the line to say anything.  Just the same canned music playing over and over and over and over on a loop.  Called again.  Asked for a supervisor, but my phone died because I'd been held on the line so long.  He didn't call back.  I gave up because I had to give up.  Otherwise, I'd have a stroke from my anger and high blood pressure.  Amazon, you suck. Every single time I have a problem now, this is what I encounter.  Amazon is no longer a great company.  It's a company that will cut every corner, that disrespects its customers and their time, and that cares only about its bottom line.  It will go the way of Sears because it deserves to.

Amazon security is rubbish. Our family Amazon account has been fully hacked, and our hacker easily managed to change our account phone number, email and password on our Amazon account without a single barrier stopping that hacker. Now our hacker has access to our home address and bank cards in our Amazon account, which is really worrying. We received an email from Amazon that our old email address A has been changed to the new email address B, which was shocking because we never changed our email address. Amazon could have send us a link in that same email to give an option to undo this email change if it wasn't us, something that all big companies have for their customer account like gmail. Or Amazon could have send a code to our phone number or old email address that our hacker needed access to before that hacker could change our account email address or password so basically some sort of security barrier, but clearly Amazon thought that there was no need for any of these barrier even if everyones Amazon account contains peoples bank card and personal details plus our hacker can freely order stuff on our account and properly will do other suspicious acts. Who ever made Amazon website have clearly lacked some simple security standards. I called Amazon customer service (which Amazon customer service was hard to find because we didn't have access to our Amazon account) and they said that they cannot close our account that has been hacked because the email and phone number has been changed by our hacker and we also can no longer access it.

I've been a pretty frequent amazon customer over at least the last two decades. The downfall started with a decision to purchase a macbook pro for around $3000. A large purchase, but I had confidence that if anything went wrong amazon would right things quickly. I received a one time passcode or OTP as they refer to it. I greeted the amazon delivery person, I gave him the passcode several times- he kept repeating it back incorrectly. I took the package and remarked to my girlfriend that man they make macs light these days. I opened the package to find an obviously used and abused macbook box. I opened the box with an ever increasing heart rate as I knew at this point my worst fears were about to be realized. It was EMPTY! My girlfriend rushed out the door to the driver who was just down the street. He stated you want to look in the back of my truck? Nothing I can do, call amazon support. Of course I called right away. I sat on hold for at least 30-40 mins. Amazon's first attempt at resolving the issue was to tell me there was nothing that could be done since I gave them the OTP- they stated I should call the police???!!!! When I refused and stated I had already wasted my day with this whole situation they put me on hold again for many minutes. They finally returned and refunded my order. This person refunded me with the most disgust I've ever experienced in my years of customer service. She quickly said bye, none of the usual thanks for being an amazon customer... Little did I know the issues would only continue from here. Later that evening I received an email stating my account had most likely been hacked and all my orders were cancelled. Next I came to find out that any order around $100+ would require a OTP- meaning they send you a passcode via email a couple hrs before your order arrives that you're forced to give to the delivery person- meaning you have to be present all day long if you actually want to receive your order. That's exactly the opposite of what amazon was designed to be. I called in multiple times to have this obstruction / inconvenience removed. One person from logistics stated maybe I should buy my macbook from apple like he did? I asked if he ever bought anything on amazon for $100+ he stated no. After talking to several more people from all over the world one person agreed to give me a partial refund of around $79 of the $139 I was so exhausted I agreed to it. I now realize that it makes no sense, given it's only almost April 1st and a prorated refund would be $100+??? This has been a pretty ridiculous experience to say the least. I repeated my grievances multiple times and I don't think one person understood once, much less did they try and correct it or provide any kind of customer service. PS I'm still waiting for my $79 refund...

Jeff Bezos has the unique privilege on being classified as a rilobber baron alongside many early 20th century figures. Amazon Export Services (AES) employs the cheapest 1* rated companies for international deliveries. It makes it imposdible to record a complaint. It tells a lot of lies on its invoice about how it will handle import processes. In New Zealabd, if your package is worth more than 1000 nzd, for which you have already paid import fees, your package sits in limbo forever. Aramex NZ, which Anazon employs, is a frachisee provider. There is one customs broker who tells a lot of lies about how the the package is due soon, when it has been held by customs for 17days. The contact centre is in the phillipines and likely to hang up on you. Aamir is a bottleneck and nothing happens. He probably has too much paperwork in between delivery of 1* rated uber eats. Mr Danny Murphy, supposedluly the Canterbury General Manager of Aramex NZ (1.3* rating only because you cannot rate zero) is uncontactable. This is Amazon for you. The customer can only rate the seller who is not to blame. Customer cannot rate AES. Cunning.

I have contacted and paid international phone-fees several times (5+) to get access to my amazon.com account with digital purchases at least 5+ times over the last 5+ years.Each time the same thing happens.. After I finally get to a representative who can disable the 2FA from the old phone number it works for 2 weeks to 1 month and then the old phone number is re-enabled as 2FA on the account - completely without any action from my part.Amazon doesn't prioritize Account Recovery, otherwise there would be steps for customers to follow to disable 2FA indefinetily and regain access to the account.This is clearly not a priority however, they must assume everyone is creating new accounts - or simpy don't care.It is extremely illogical that current account login information is overwritten with old information (incl. 2FA phone number) but this is what happens.I can't access any of my digital purchases because amazon keeps locking me out of my account. This has never been an issue from my part. This is an amazon IT department technical issue relating to the account logins.I can't be the only person in the world this happens to, but I can only imagine that they are losing business cuz I have avoided amazon in every of my purchases if available elsewhere anytime, I'd even pay more to avoid amazon because this site is simply broken.What I think happens as a qualified software developer is that I think amazon has some legacy software between its site networks that might restore or synchronize an old backup incl. 2FA between accounts.There is no other logical explanation.But what is logical and completely reasonable to understand is that I will avoid amazon at all costs for all purchases.Horrible company, horrible services, horrible customer support. Avoid this trap.

WARNING - Do not use Amazon as a platform to keep your book reviews. I was stupid enough to do so for several years. A process I enjoyed and one that caused no issues. In April 2023, I submitted a review which was rejected because they said 'it breached the guidelines' Examining the guidelines it was not obvious how, but I re-wrote it, resubmitted it and heard no more. The same happened in November 2024 and then in December and completely out-of-the-blue I got an email saying 'I'd breached guidelines and my review rights had been withdrawn'. What they did not say was all my review were removed. Gone - years of input, a real treasure trove of memories of my reading hobby. From that time I tried hard to communicate with Amazon to ask that they be restored, but they were rude, hostile, they continually obfuscated, were totally unclear, seemed unable to grasp basic concepts and their responses were frequently unintelligible and on several occasions they lied. They denied repetitively they have a complaints department and they showed a general lack of any personal care or concern. This is a company that strives (so says its mission) to be the earth's most customer centric company. This is an insult to it's customers - they might delivery parcels ok, but when things go wrong they it is clear that they have the  'Earth's most incompetent customer service department'

Attempted to reinform customer service today, and at least expected to receive some Tech Support for prolific hacking of my paid Music Unlimited and paid Prime Video accounts.This had been reported to Police and Action Fraud, for some time now.Been a paying customer since 2015.This involved hijacking of my account through my devices and the downloading of movies and music from individuals I had identified, to the authorities.The fraudulent linking of much equipment such as a Fire-stick which I have never owned, in the registered devices menu.On calling customer service to end these paid services due to this intrusion, I received a Scottish Lady who seemed helpful but when she informed me I was being passed onto tech support I was left on and then hung up on.Second call to customer services involved attempting to communicate with a sarcastic female who did not seem interested, gave long deliberate hmmmms and asaaahs and told me tech support wasn't on call.I asked why and she just repeated the same answer.I then received an email from this agent informing me that she was ending my services, deleting all accounts and data records from my memberships of paid Prime services with Amazon.I had not requested this and found this suspicious, considering the continuous hacking and downloading of data from Music  unlimited and Prime video account of mine, which I had paid for and as I had reported.Third operator seemed marginally interested enough to correct this involuntary action by the previous operator.It seems a dark cloud has descended on Amazon on multiple levels and I won't be paying for any more services untill this has lifted.

Honestly I could not make this up.I landed back in the UK a month ago and ordered a new sim/mobile number on contract.  Updated my Amazon account using my mobile.  Went to my account a few days later to order something but kept getting a wrong password message.  I reset my password and placed an order using my new debit card.  Changed the address to my new address.Problem was it wasn‚Äôt my account.  Someone had my mobile number before me and I had inadvertently hacked their account.  There address, their card details, their order history, all there for me to read.I contact Amazon and we go through the process of sorting out the mess.  They cancel my order for me and I was promised that no payment would be taken from my card.I re-order on my own account.After checking my bank account I find I‚Äôve been billed twice.  I don‚Äôt get the order twice, just the money removed from my account.I have called several times to sort this mess only to be told by various agents that they can help me as the transaction I am disputing is‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..on someone else‚Äôs account!!!I now appreciate why Jeff is doing so well.As of today the 14th of March I am still waiting for my money back.

- A customer of 8 YearsAs a company in terms of offering customers value it  undeniably does so. I dont use their software services much as I already had spotify/ youtube but have still got value from prime delivery through their food and items as well as occasional prime video and audible. There's more they can be doing environmentally to offset such a large footprint but due to how logistically efficient they are it brings down the CO2 emissions per parcel compared to driving to collect the same item yourself! They can also invest in electric or alterenative fuel methods for their vehicles.Paper and cardboard packaging on all orders is recyclable/reusable and I've been able to support small online/sustainable businesses through the marketplace The shopping experience is excellent and the delivery very professional.The value offered is great, and with such a large selection of products and reviews its not difficult to find what you're after. The tracking and history of orders is exceptional, as well as the ability to create multiple lists (wish lists) that could be shared.Used items can also be found on the platform too, which is a better choice for the environment than brand new, I've recently found a growing offering of recycled plastic items which is even better as it creates a demand to get the products out of our environment.I barely touched on the software/ streaming applications and services offered which is a large part of the subscription and could be worth the monthly fee in it's own right.I'd be quite surprised if you had anything but a positive experience. I can't comment from an empoyee/ seller side of the company but as a customer I keep coming back and will continue to aslong as I receive great service. As buyers we need to continue to carefully consider the demand our purchases place on the environment but it's good to know that Amazon can align with this goal shoud we choose to.I look forward to seeing more sustainably powered vans adopted and encouragement for smaller local and quality goods sellers promoted on the home page.

A couple of weeks ago, Amazon abruptly canceled my account. I was attempting to access my account to make a purchase, and upon reaching the login page and entering my credentials, the following message appeared: ‚ÄòYour account has been terminated for improper use of Amazon services. We have sent you an email with more information.‚Äô (It was written in Italian, I translated it with Google translate). However, no email arrived in my inbox despite repeated attempts. I began searching online to see if anyone else had encountered the same issue. I found an email address where I could file a complaint. They responded stating: ‚Äòas already communicated to you, we have closed this account. From our records, we have previously terminated your account for violating the terms of our user agreement. Following termination of your account due to breach of contract, you are not permitted to open a new account or use another account to place orders on our site. Following a thorough evaluation, we have decided not to restore your full access to this account. It will therefore not be possible for you to place orders on our site. Any digital content purchased with this account is still available to you. To access the content, click the Manage content and devices link in the My Orders menu on Amazon.it.‚Äô Despite my attempts to seek clarification, they provided the same generic responses, failing to explain the exact reason for the account termination and how I violated the terms of the agreement. Furthermore, they mentioned that I could still access digital content purchased with the account, which was untrue since my account was closed, leaving me without access to anything.Adding insult to injury, I own a Kindle that was linked to my account. A few days later, I attempted to read a book on my Kindle. As I am Russian and my Amazon account is Italian (and all the books in the Amazon store are either in Italian or English), I purchase eBooks from Russian websites and download them via USB from my PC to my Kindle. However, that night when I opened my Kindle, it was EMPTY!!! All my books were gone! And on the screen was the login page to the Amazon account, which I no longer had access to. Here arises an interesting question: how did they learn that my account was closed if my device was not connected to Wi-Fi? This implies that Amazon has another means of controlling my data and my device. All the books I downloaded, all the notes I made in the books, all the progress I made (I usually read several books at the same time) - everything was gone! An empty Kindle!!!I am deeply disappointed and angry with the situation and feel utterly helpless in resolving this problem. My account was canceled without explanation, I cannot ask questions through the app's customer service as my account is closed, Amazon support has ceased responding to my emails, my Kindle books have been deleted, and there is no one who seems to care or can offer assistance in any way to address this issue.

As a seller on Amazon's platform, I must express my utter disappointment and frustration with their blatant disregard for the well-being of their sellers. It's evident that Amazon prioritizes profit over the integrity of its marketplace, as they consistently side with consumers even in cases of obvious fraud, leaving sellers to bear the brunt of the consequences.One of the most egregious issues plaguing Amazon's marketplace is their lenient approach towards fraudulent claims made by customers. Despite ample evidence proving that customers have received the items they ordered, Amazon readily refunds them at the expense of the sellers. This not only results in financial losses for sellers but also creates an environment ripe for exploitation.The fact that Amazon retains the fees they charge sellers, even in cases of fraudulent refunds, highlights their complete lack of accountability. Sellers invest their time, resources, and efforts into the platform, only to be met with indifference and exploitation by Amazon.Unlike on my own website, where stringent policies deter fraudulent activities, Amazon's lax approach enables customers to exploit the system with impunity. The frequency of such occurrences is alarming and severely undermines the profitability of selling on Amazon.It's evident that Amazon's policies are designed to prioritize market share over the well-being of sellers. Their relentless pursuit of dominance in the e-commerce industry has led them to sacrifice the livelihoods of countless sellers in the process. It's high time that sellers unite and hold Amazon accountable for their unethical practices.In conclusion, Amazon's facilitation of fraud and exploitation of sellers is unacceptable. Their policies not only undermine the integrity of the marketplace but also pose a significant threat to the livelihoods of sellers. It's imperative that sellers take a stand against such injustice and demand accountability from Amazon.

Amazon has resorted to cheating and illegal tactics. Tired of waiting for ARC (Amazon Claims Department) to process my claim, I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau.  Within 12 HOURS I got two phone calls and an email from the lawyer representing ARC, expressing his wish to settle.  The next day, I got another email or phone call from the same lawyer. In the email he stated he agreed to what I had claimed.  And I gave the lawyer permission to cut the check by email. I am sharing this because I am so surprised at how expediently they want to avoid a lawsuit.  It must not look good to have high numbers of lawsuits filed against Amazon to report in their Annual Report to their shareholders.  "Claim # AMZ.  Christina is the person handling the case.On a rainy day, an Amazon driver attempted to back out of my driveway, skidding down and running over my mailbox.  The van got stuck on the mailbox post, and a tow truck was called to pull out the van.  The damage to the lawn and the mailbox is well documented in video and photos, which ARC received.  Most recently, ARC stated that since I had filed for lawn damage 3 years ago, this is a repeat claim.   And demands that I submit a photo of the lawn repair from three years ago because the present lawn damage may be a replicated claim.  And I quote Christina from ARC representing Amazon.com.   "As for the previous damages and showing the repairs, this is a new policy that has been put in place. Unfortunately this alerts us to people who have filed multiple times for damages."  My argument is when new damages are inflicted by Amazon drivers,  Amazon should pay for damages no matter when it occurs.  When I sent her the email from three years ago, which never mentioned a photo she was using to reject the claim, she stated that she would look into it.  It is impossible to produce a photo from three years ago that was not taken or requested.  It is such a nonsense to reject a claim.  And Christina will ignore me until I bug her again; this has been going on for over THREE months!    It is utterly surprising that Amazon has resorted to this kind of CUSTOMER UNFRIENDLY practice.  Amazon.com is NOT a customer-friendly company!  I will file a claim with the small claims court.  I am so disappointed at how awful Amazon has turned out.  Seeing the same type of claim as mine here shows that this is not just one ARC representative who has gone rogue. It is Amazon's policy.

I am out 3k and they think that is "professional". I should mention to that the TV is now out of stock as well. They are saying they can have another week but I'm not optimistic. I'm still out 300$ for the Install that I will never get back. I don't even know of it is worth seeking counsel on this or not. As it stands I am out of alot of money with nothing to show for it.

We've requested on Amazon that all deliveries be left at our front door not the entry gate, a 20 step walk to the front door. Lately that's totally ignored by the drivers and tonight the driver left 4 big boxes outside the gate and my wife was able to catch him getting into his truck and he just ignored her and ran away. We order lots from Amazon and don't want it stolen and also I'm 80 years old and home today from another medical procedure so would be nice to have our delivery request honored and not ignored by these lazy drivers. The following are the order numbers which were left at the gate with the explicit sign to deliver everything to the front door.111-4651581-4353842, 111-4651581-4353842,113-7714709-5873865, 111-4651581-4353842Because of our age we rely on these deliveries so don't want them stolen!Finally we did get the dresser delivered with one of the drawers broken. Drivers who were from Wayfair as they wore Wayfair shirts and drove a Wayfair truck we noted to them the broken drawer and did not sign for the delivery. The driver stated he would notify Wayfair and that they'd send someone to fix the drawer or replace the dresser. Next we find out the driver most likely told Wayfair nothing and we were billed full tilt for the dresser. So the battle now going on 3 months goes on and what more can I say but I would never buy from Wayfair again and hope others that might, would read this saga and do the same not ordering from them.

I strongly caution anyone who buys from Amazon to LOOK FOR ALTERNATIVE VENDORS as I ordered and paid ¬£483.00 + ¬£4.99 for 24 hour premium delivery for a brand new Gigaset GX6 smartphone from Amazon on 15/09/2023 and was fraudulently sent an unsealed / opened used ¬£282.00 phone in a tatty water-soiled box. It is a textbook example of capitalism gone mad. Squeeze out the competition to such a degree that you're answerable to no-one. Become such a monopoly that cities outbid each other to offer tax-incentives to build one of their modern day slavery 'fulfilment' centres in their locality. And when something goes wrong who is there to talk to? Chatbots, phonebots and livechat with Indians who have no authority to do anything but read out scripts. There is no accountability. And all the while we sit here addicted to plastic tat, fuming at delivery drivers who are paid peanuts per parcel, powerless as Amazon evades tax on an industrial scale while valued at multiple trillions of dollars. How are the state schools doing in your area? Hospitals? Police force well funded? Roads in good nick? No, they're not in my neighbourhood either. That's thanks to mega-corps like Amazon whose stock price has rocketed while your teachers and nurses go to food banks.

Package tracking stated "delivered", but it wasn't. The ordering was straightforward and the delivery to a business address was clear. The tracking status was changed to "delivered" - allegedly personally to the recipient - but nothing had been delivered. Following Amazon's guidance, we waited 48 hours before trying to contact them - which they don't make easy. Speaking to the customer service advisor they offered a replacement or refund. We chose replacement as we wanted the items. As potential future customers we wanted to know whether Amazon would be safe and reliable by asking what had caused the delivery failure and to receive an email or phone call describing how the problem had been resolved. Either the driver accidentally scanned the item and then binned, stole, or lost it; or the driver delivered it to the wrong address; or the driver left it outside the building and lied about handing it to the recipient. None of these are acceptable. The first customer service advisor told us the vehicle was moving and that the package would probably be delivered late. They then gauranteed that it would be delivered within 48 hours (it wasn't). The second customer service advisor offered the replacement or refund and refused to offer any communication about what went wrong and what they were doing about it. Amazon, you have multiple systemic failures in your system and your refusal to engage with curious and unsatisfied customers does not fill us with confidence regarding your services.

What happened to Amazon???Been a customer for over 20 years and I had so much trust with Amazon until what happened today...For reference:2/19I placed a high value item order (a smartphone) with my Prime account. 2/20 Amazon first updated item to be delivered by 2/23.2/23 Item not arrived and pushed to the next day.2/26 Still no delivery and no more tracking update. Upon contacting Chatbot, delivery date pushed to 2/27.2/28 Live online chat agent report item is lost by carrier and I need to fill out an incident report. Requested phone call from Amazon that I wanted to cancel my order and get refund ASAP.Phone assistant claims the item was never lost and should deliver on 2/28 but due to my cancelation request, item will go back to Amazon and refund can take up to a month. I asked what happened if the item is indeed lost per the other agent's claim and never returned to Amazon? Agent has no knowledge of the consequences that may affect my refund process. Now I'm left feeling extremely concerned without my highly anticipated new phone and no refund in time to repurchase it before I travel abroad.The huge disconnect between the Chat and the Phone customer services providing inconsistent information/solutions has made me lost my trust with Amazon. On top of that, major problems with the security of high value item shipment.I am ok with longer delivery time if it's stated in advance. However, I don't feel safe as a customer when items were advertised with Prime shipping that came without proper updates resulting lost or never delivered package.Amazon was known for their quality and fast services, but sadly, I would need to find alternatives from now on.

BEWARE OF AMAZON!  I paid for some recent orders for a birthday party with gift cards, specifically because I don't want Amazon to have my bank info.  (In America, we are free to shop anonymously, but Amazon seems determined to stop that.) When I placed another order to use up the balance on my gift card, I got the message below.  I've wasted hours trying to either get my merchandise or my money back for the gift card. Presently, I have neither.ü§¨"Your Amazon account is temporarily on hold."Hello,"We have detected unusual payment activity on your Amazon account [An Amazon gift card is unusual?!]. For your protection, we have temporarily placed your account on hold and placed any pending orders [that I already paid for!] or subscriptions on hold as well."If we are unable to confirm your payment information within 72 hours, your pending orders will be canceled. Your account will remain on hold until we are able to confirm that you are the authorized owner of the payment method used in the recent transaction [How can I prove I own a gift card??!!!!]."To restore access to your account, sign in and follow the on-screen instructions. You will have the option to upload a document [A billing or banking statement!!ü§¨] with the required information to verify your account. Once you have provided this document, we will review it and respond within 24 hours. [So if I don't, they keep the money I paid for the gift card?!!]"When uploading a document to verify the ownership of a payment method [I have to do all this to buy something with a gift card at Amazon?!üò≥], be sure that the name, address, payment type, and relevant transaction information are clearly visible. For your security, only display the last 4 digits of the payment method number..."HOW AND WHY WOULD I PROVIDE THIS INFO IF I PAID WITH A GIFT CARD?!  Their whole retail operation is clearly a ruse to get your sensitive information into their database.  You can't buy anonymously from them.  BOYCOTT AMAZON to do at least a little something to fend off the Chinese-style fascist state they want!   They chose their name appropriately from the outset:  AMAZON - to dwarf all us little people and force us to submit to their will.  Americans BEWARE!

I have been an Amazon customer for 15 years but unfortunately I will not be renewing my Prime membership or ordering from Amazon anymore. I had ordered a computer and was sent the wrong computer. I sent it back and did get my refund right  away. I ordered another computer from a different seller and was sent the wrong computer once again. I received an approval from the seller immediatly to return it, so I returned it immediately. This particular seller decided to not issue a refund. I reached out to him and he was telling me how he is "investigating" it, even though he sent the wrong computer.  However, he used the "investigation" as an excuse to hold my money hostage for weeks. I really needed my money back as computers cost alot of money and I needed to buy another one since I had dropped and broken mine. I reached out to Amazon customer service and the customer service rep profusely apologized and said they would submit the prime A-Z guarantee ticket and also give me a $10 gift certificate credit to my Amazon account for my troubles. I was pleased about this and was immediately sent a survey in which I gave raving reviews of the customer service I had just received. However, as time passed,  I hadn't heard a word nor did I receive any confirmation email and also didn't see any $10 gift card credit. I had to take time out to reach customer service again and the new agent said, I'm so sorry the agent before me never submitted the ticket for refund request and did not give you the $10 credit. I couldn't believe it and wondered what kind of customer service is this? So this new rep and me went back and forward with a bunch of bs they were telling me that this computer  isn't covered with A-Z guarantee and there is nothing they can do. I reminded the agent it WAS listed as Prime and they are incorrect and then I started asking what is wrong with Amazon sellers and customer service at Amazon? I told this agent I have witnessed some of the sellers and customer service going downhill fast. I asked them if Amazon is supporting their sellers stealing from their customers  even when they order a Prime listed product. All of a sudden it was a miracle as the rep decided to issue my return. I asked him, how about issuing me the $10 credit also. This rep said, oh yes, of course, but it will take at least a couple hours to register in your account. At this point, it was no surprise that I never have received the $10 gift card credit nor any notice about it even being initiated. Needless to say, I am bewildered. I decided to get a Costco membership the next day and have already found replacements for many things I've ordered over the years with Amazon and set up to have my account not renew my Prime membership in April. Something is seriously wrong at Amazon now and they lost me as a customer.  I have ordered thousands of dollars each year for many years. Here is a statement from Jeff Bezos I found on the Internet. ‚ÄúWe have always wanted to be Earth‚Äôs Most Customer-Centric Company.  We won‚Äôt change that. It‚Äôs what got us here.  But I am committing us to an addition.  We are going to be Earth‚Äôs Best Employer and Earth‚Äôs Safest Place to Work.‚Äù  My question to Jeff is....what kind of "addition"  have you established in the workplace that allows shady sellers and awful customer service? I looked online and found a bunch of complaints about the seller who people are saying is an outright thief. It took me two minutes to run the company name and find this information. It took me to long to figure out how to see the actual Amazon seller reviews on which seems like it is hidden it's so hard to find now. I wrote a review stating what happened,  but to date I can't see it on his Amazon seller account and he's still on Amazon selling his computers! This is not acceptable.

Told them to deliver by UPS or Fed Ex. Of course they didn't and used their own service. 2nd time their delivery person sent package back because they couldn't find address. Not smart enough to read a map I guess. I am done with Amazon.

Yet again I am appalled that every single item in the order is put in a separate large plastic bag eg I returned 6 pairs of identical plastic gloves (wrong size)  and each one has to go in its own huge plastic bag. At a time when we are trying to cut back on use of plastic, this is an outrageous disregard for the environment
