My son was scammed and ripped off by Amazon!!! In general, I love Amazon and their products and services. But recently my son who is 18 opened an Amazon account and I wanted to teach him how to use and order from Amazon. Of course, we ordered goods like "warm socks". A few days later the courier delivered to the wrong address well, according to the photo of the 'proof of delivery' we were able to prove that it was not our address and house and of course it was refund done. A few weeks later we tried to order again exactly the same and guess what, the same again! This time he got a "suspicious activity warning" warning on my son's account and I tried to speak to customer service to confirm it wasn't his fault! A few months later he ordered 'headphones' which cost around ¬£100 so guess what, same thing happened again!!! We were at home and no delivery only an email that you received the parcel...?! I called again and told the situation that we did not receive the shipment, I have security camera footage and can send proof that the courier was not at my place at the time. He said wait a few days and maybe the courier will deliver because sometimes the system mistakenly says delivered but they are still on their way. So we waited and called again after a few days. They advised to check the neighbors and come back in 48 hours. After a few days we called again... they said that will investigate and report back. After that call... a few days later my son's account was suspended due to an investigation. Tried to contact again and called like 10 more times trying to figure out what's going on here....asked for a photo of "Proof of Delivery"....but (still haven't received it yet) ...so they shut down completely account and did not refund because their courier said the package was delivered safely to the location. today I spoke to an amazon "manager" who did not help me at all...couldn't give a ''Proof Of Delivery''...and no one can help because the courier said the item was delivered to the address and she can't change anything. The advice was from her... to contact the police...... So my son was left without money and without headphones. Therefore, dear future customers of Amazon....be careful...because if the courier steals from you...amazon will do nothing and you will be left without money and goods...and nothing to prove that it is not your fault. I am very disappointed with amazon!!! It's very scary that in the UK there are no laws that would protect the common citizens and such companies can steal from simple people's... it's very disappointing....

It's high time for Amazon to step up their game and provide the reliable and trustworthy service that customers deserve.

Avoid Purchasing from Third Party Sellers on AmazonI recently purchased an item through Amazon that was sold by a third party seller. During shipping, the carrier marked the package as "incorrect address" without attempting delivery and said it would be returned to sender.After weeks of trying to get this resolved, neither the carrier nor third party seller could deliver the item or provide a refund. When I complained to Amazon, their customer service repeatedly passed the buck back to the third party seller rather than helping as the merchant of record.I offered extensive documentation, screenshots, and spent hours on calls trying to reach a solution. Amazon refused to step in and resolve the situation themselves, even after it was clear the package was lost. They would only say they "notified the seller on my behalf" but took no responsibility.It is unacceptable that Amazon sold this item but then refused to remedy their inability to fulfill the purchase as promised. After threatening chargebacks and complaints, Amazon still denied a refund and closed the case. They clearly have no intention of standing behind third party transactions that go wrong.I will never purchase something sold by third parties on Amazon again after this nightmare experience. Amazon has proven they are unwilling to protect customers when issues arise beyond our control. It is a waste of time to work with their customer service, who will only pass you off endlessly without resolving the problems their marketplace creates. Buyer beware of this risk if using third party sellers on Amazon!

I ordered a rollator walker for my 91-year old mother on 2/5/24. I was promised delivery by 9 p.m. 2/6/24. At about noon on 2/6/24 I went to track shipment and saw that the delivery date was now changed to 2/27/24 by 9 p.m -- even though it was picked up from a carrier facility 7 miles from the delivery address. I was back and forth with customer service chat who didn't want to tell me why it would be an extra day to deliver an item 7 miles away. They deflected and gave me UPS's number. UPS told me that it told Amazon last night that it wouldn't be able to deliver it today.Meanwhile, Amazon stopped the chat while I was holding with UPS and I had to start again. For a $250 item they wanted to offer me a $10 gift card. Then they offered instead a month off my prime membership -- and cut off the chat again. I called customer service but apparently they said they were the promotion department. They said as a gift and an apology they'd offer me a $100 voucher but I would have to pay for the shipping and handling. I pointed out that it's not a gift if I have to pay shipping and handling. The rep said he wasn't charging for the voucher just the shipping and handling. I told him that's not the way to treat a loyal prime customer. He kept saying "OK you're not interested" and I said that wasn't true I just didn't feel I should have to pay shipping and handling. He hung up on me.I called again and got through to customer service and he said he couldn't give any compensation, then said he could give $5. I told him that I had saved the previous chats and I was offered a month of free membership (about $12). He said Amazon can't do that which I know isn't true. I asked for an email address to send the chat and he wouldn't give me an email address. He then hung up.This is Amazon's idea of customer service. You are warned.If you want to order from Amazon, don't order anything big that you really need at a specific time -- and when they promise you something don't believe them.

Although I have been using AMAZON for over 10 years, I noticed lately that their delivery service has detreated beyond imagination. Not only the drivers will drop the parcel at the door without even considering ringing the door-bell (if the parcel is to large to go through the letter-box) regardless to the weather condition. They use to be careful about delivering the parcels but no anymore!! It could be a result of work pressure and delivery quota per driver. Our house is located on the corner of two roads with a front garden leading to the front door via our drive. Last Friday 02nd Feb we were expecting a delivery of a new air-fryer as notified by AMAZON. We were sitting watching TV at lounge which by the front door at around four o'clock in the afternoon when I received an e-mail  from AMAZON stating the the package was delivered and left by the front door (with a photo showing that), so immediately we open the door but found nothing!!!! We looked everywhere around the house in case the driver decided to hide the package but there was nothing!! It is unusal for our neighbours to pick anything from the front of our door unless we were on a holiday and have requested them to do so! Our neighbourhood where we live, is very safe and never encountered nor heard of any theft! Furthermore, It needed someone there and ready for the delivery to be dropped so that he/she swiftly grab  it and run with it which is remotely to happen. Unless, the driver took the photo and picked it up again and took it. No one would've  suspected that action as it would look as if he was returning the item back to the van!! Even if we caught him doing it, he could easily say I didn't want to leave it at the door!!  Both our cars where there on the drive and our door-bell is working!!!!!!! So, we called AMAZON who initially integrated us asking if we are sure is not there, or with neighbours ..etc before telling us that we need to wait 72 hours before we can report it undelivered. So, we waited until Monday 05th and we requested a call-back where we discussed the issue!! Regrettably, the customer-service agent who was based in Ireland could not get through to the correct department who could resolve the issue and told us that she will leave a message on the system for them to call us back and assured us that the case will be resolved. No call was received so today (Tue 06th) once again requested a call back and we spoken to another agent based in Ireland who passed us to another colleague (sounded as if based in India) and who also passed us to another of his colleagues there who told us that they 72 hours  to investigate the matter and we have to wait!! Besides being frustrated with this matter, we feel as if we were accused of false claim!!!   Shameful that AMAZON treats customers like this!!!   .

I purchased an item over $1000, but it was stopped at the custom of my country due to lacking permission from the laws, and I had to return the item. The carrier received my request to return the item on 14 Jan 2024. The item had been kept by the carrier at all time. Since then I contacted with Amazon representative several times to ask about my refund. Some even promised I would receive after 2 days because I was a loyal customer, but they are just liars. Even one of their colleagues told me they were wrong, when I quoted the promises. Today, I talked with one supervisor, and the only thing she provided is that I would receive my refund once they receive the item because the item has high value.  I think at some point I will receive my money, but I don't think my case is acceptable to every customer. I don't even have a chance to see the item, so if it was damaged it is not my fault. What is the reason to hold my money for so long? If their employees could consider my case with common sense, they could do more than just generic, useless instruction, as a machine. Either Amazon tries to exploit me or their system is at fault. Either case, I would have to pay interest for the credit I used to buy such item if Amazon does not refund me on time.

Where do I even begin? My encounter with Amazon's customer service was nothing short of a nightmare. It's as if they go out of their way to make your life difficult.Firstly, getting in touch with a representative is like navigating a maze blindfolded. The automated system seems designed to frustrate and confuse you at every turn. And don't even think about trying to find a direct line to speak with a real person ‚Äì it's like searching for a needle in a haystack.When I finally did manage to connect with someone, they were about as helpful as a broken pencil. It's like they're trained to provide the least amount of assistance possible. Instead of resolving my issue, they passed me from one department to another, each time repeating the same tiresome process of explaining my problem from scratch.And let's not forget about the wait times. I could have watched the entire Lord of the Rings trilogy twice over while waiting for a response. It's almost as if they take pleasure in making you wait endlessly, dangling the hope of resolution like a carrot on a stick.To top it all off, when a resolution was finally offered, it was so inadequate that I might as well have been talking to a brick wall. It's clear that Amazon's customer service is more concerned with closing tickets than actually solving problems.Save yourself the headache and frustration. Avoid Amazon's customer service like the plague. It's an experience you'll regret ‚Äì one that will leave you questioning why you ever chose to do business with them in the first place.

Amazon's A to Z guarantee is worthless. It only reassures customers until you actually need it. Then you wake up very unpleasantly.I had always thought that Amazon was on my side in the fight against unfair sellers, but far from it: they take their side and leave me out in the rain.There are now many alternatives to Amazon, I'm just discovering them online and I'm using them more and more.

Here's the thing about mega huge companies that service consumers: They don't need to care about you. If a company has many millions of customers, and 90% of those customers escape doing business with amazon without issues, then the company has little to worry about.If amazon is making enough to send rockets into space, build their own warehouses, and buy their own delivery vehicles, they just don't need to care.I've been using amazon for decades and I suspect my recent issues have to do with policies enacted specifically to increase revenues.A few years ago I got locked out of my amazon account and customer service was no help. I pleaded with them to allow me SOME way to prove my identity beyond their asinine "tell us the last 3 things you ordered." At that point, I hadn't used my account in 3 months so I just did not remember the last 3 things I ordered, AND, amazon had at that point stopped showing orders on order confirmation emails. Instead, confirmation emails were only giving a link back to your amazon order page. Useless if you're locked out of your account. I did ultimately realize a way to get back into the account on my own.Most recently, while traveling, I ordered some items from different sellers, but items fulfilled by amazon to be delivered to an amazon locker. I waited, and then checked the amazon order page which showed that ALL the items were cancelled. I called amazon customer service but they knew absolutely nothing, so I reordered those items and waited again. A week later, I checked the amazon order page and yet again, all items were cancelled. This time, I insisted on talking to someone above the first person I spoke to. Then, they ended up handing me off to an actual American who worked specifically with the lockers, but that person just listened to my complaint and then said they'd tell someone else, blah, blah, blah. For some reason the UPS driver was cancelling my orders and nobody would tell me why. When I went to make the order a third time, I saw on the order page, for the first time, in red text, that the locker I had chosen was full. Mystery solved, no thanks to amazon, because they obviously have a low cost deal with UPS to deliver packages to their amazon lockers and the deal does not include bringing undeliverable items to a UPS facility so a customer can pick stuff up there. Instead, the driver just cancels the order and everything gets returned to amazon fulfillment centers with zero notification to the customer. My other major issue with amazon is that they did away with commenting on reviews for products. This was a super valuable method of sharing information with other consumers who took the time to write reviews. I suspect they stopped allowing this because people occasionally were recommending different products and that was obviously not good for them. Amazon has gotten progressively more and more antagonistic towards consumers but they know they can because there just is no alternative for us.

What is going on with this company?!It used to be trustworthy and reliable.Lately, I've had parcels not arrive even though it said handed to resident! Yesterday, I ordered a phone charger to arrive the next day because the one I'm using isn't fully connecting. I should have gone and found one in a shop instead of relying on this dreadful company!Here I am still sitting waiting for it at 8.15pm, knowing full well that it won't arrive tonight.I'm now wasting my 7% charge on writing an angry review!From now on, I will go into the city and find things myself. If I can't rely on Amazon, then there's no hope for online shopping anymore.

Amazon received two $100 Visa debit gift cards from me - these were referral rewards from my health sharing program. The first I loaded per online instructions as a debit card, and it looked fine, for a day. I then loaded the second Visa debit gift card, but it loaded as $89.12 instead of $100. Got on chat and went through 3 people until one of them said something like "Okay, I'm adding $11, plus a $10 courtesy for your trouble." It was apparently a glitch in the system. The Visa debit was showing as $100.12 on the order. I then ordered a vacuum cleaner, putting the balance on my CC. TODAY my account now says "We couldn't charge your selected payment method, so we charged your backup payment method." They charged my CC $100. This is not cool. I am doubly paying the $100 for the vacuum. Back to the first Visa debit card, which I loaded and had appeared as a gift card with $100 in the system. I received an email on 01/31/2024 that said I had successfully loaded it, and they gave an $8 bonus for the load. Great! Problem is, it was zeroed out quickly, and when I went through the chat, one guy told me the amount would be reloaded within 24-48 hours. I then got an email saying that the payment failed. Of course it failed! They already got it from the card balance!Back to chat the morning of 02/02. They sent me to a phone person immediately, a lady named T. She was SO rude, as we had a lag, and she insisted on schooling me about how there was now no lag and so forth. T. was completely condescending. Needs education about tech and how to treat customers with respect. She  finally told me that the first thing people usually do is call the issuing bank. I am not in the habit of using Visa debit gift cards, and did not know that. She treated me like a child. I called the bank and they were completely helpful, giving me two transaction numbers when Amazon transferred funds into their system. But this is for Visa Debit GC #1. Who knows if it will work? I still have to try to claw $ back from them for the vacuum cleaner purchase with Visa debit #2. This has already cost me 2 hours of work. SO frustrated.The upshot - DON'T trust Amazon to deal with these debit gift cards. Their system will steal your money. Their Customer Service is quite ineffective and apparently doesn't work for this issue. They should be set up to not receive them at all, since it's so screwed up.I will edit this post after my next contact with Amazon Customer Service.

I was offered a FREE 7 day, NO OBLIGATION trial of Amazon PRIME as I landed at the check out webpage. I opted in: "sure why not says I"However after a day or so, I had buyer's remorse and choose to cancel my Amazon Prime membership. What happened next was disappointing:My item went missing for 10 days without a notification from the seller - who had shipped it - or Amazon PRIME - who had lost it! Reaching out to Amazon online, I asked what had happened to my purchase. Having been compelled to call Amazon, after a long wait, I opted for a call back. A very nice lady offered me a full refund. FYI, this option was not displayed to me online. "Great ! thanks, yes please. Let's do that". Guess what happened next? She sends the money back into my credit card account  and withing a couple of hours of it happily resting in my account - don't I get an email next day saying the product was being delivered!  It arrives; I print the RETURNS LABELS and stick them to the unopened box. Then I noticed that the Package required a STAMP, which turned out to be ‚Ç¨9.00 So I found myself being put in a position of PAYING for accepting a NO OBLIGATION FREE TRAIL OF AMAZON PRIME 24-48 HOUR SHIPPING - should I RETURN a refunded order. Mmmm!?!OR alternately I am tacitly being invited to injure my personal integrity if I don't post the (now) unwanted item back to the shop who in fact had sold and shipped it in good faith. It seems to me that it ought to be the manager responsible for the online Free AMAZON PRIME trail promotion- who should be the individual sanctioned for making an offer s/he never intended to honor in word as well as spirit.  Shame on you Sir or Madam, no doubt on a lower wrung of the Regional management ladder, on your shifting your lack of integrity from yourself and onto the shop or the guileless customer you have out witted today. Are you proud of your interpretation of fair procedure of a dispute between a shop, a customer and Amazon Prime?

Just sheer incompetence being displayed on the part of this organization and never wanting to take full responsibility for their actions, especially when it comes to making mistakes and then they have the gaul and nerve to accuse me of lying to them?! So in a nutshell this past week, I ordered a Coke Zero mini fridge they were selling and there are two different designs to them, one has a bottle on it and the other has a full logo splurged horizontally across the door, and thinking I was finally going to receive the bottled version after two other attempts at getting this resulted in returning them both back for full refunds, a few leadership team members had promised and assured me I would finally be receiving the item that is pictured and when I received the item late last night at home (1/20/2024), I received yet the same item I received the other two times over and now having to return that as well. I have been in constant battles with their inept & incompetent customer service division & I have requested to speak to higher ups there to rectify this problem, but they have done nothing but lead me astray like a puppy dog, ignoring my requests and then accusing me of lying to them that I actually received the correct item when I did not & I showed them the two links in question, side to side and pinpointed this in as many ways as possible, but still, they refuse to do anything to help me out and I have just about had it with them. I submitted further proof & evidence as they had requested to show them I was not making any of this stuff up and I never heard back from them, so I re-contacted them to no avail, so hoping this situation gets remedied this once & for all! They're oblivious to never wanting to admit they were at fault for anything but rather, blame the customers and now they're asking for solid proof too?! Well, they got it as this kind of chicanery needs to cease right here and now!All this over a mini fridge they're selling that has two different logos to it and when you order it from them, what is displayed versus what one actually does receive are literally quite different in so many ways and aspects, as it's beyond comprehension with them. Just a sad excuse for an organization to be doing any of this to their loyal and faithful customers.UPDATE on 1/23/2024 at 2 PM CT...Well, I have to give them credit where credit is due as it took a major interaction with their corporate team and CEO to get to the bottom of this craziness and I am happy to report that they came through with fixing this messed up and screwed up order and they even offered humblest apologies for accusing me of lying about everything associated with that order and what I received and such. I still would be very cautious about doing business with them, no matter how well known they are as their customer service division really needs a huge and major overall and to bring in people who can actually speak the English language properly and truly give a damn about helping their customers who keep that business afloat on a daily basis. I can hope, right?!

l have been ordering from Amazon for awhile with no problems, until NOW!!!..l am a Senior 89yrs, & during the Xmas season found it very useful.However some of the items, (4, to be exact) had to be returned..The returns were initiated at different times, firstly 2 items, then l more, with no problem..Intel picked them up...The last item was refused with a pickup, and had to have a label to be returned, l do not have a printer, neither does anyone l know...l am now trying to figure out how to do this, the item cost $85.79...In the past l have not returned that many items, so why has Amazons policy changed ?..How many items are you allowed to return, and how often ?..Any orders l have returned were thru UPS with no issues, they printed the label & it was returned without dispute...l guess my question is HAS AMAZON & PRIME changed their RETURN POLICY ? How does a Senior without a printer, return an Item ? Where does a person go to get a LABEL printed ? Someone told me the Library, how does this work when the instructions are on my laptop ? l know l am looking for an EXCEPTION due to my AGE, which will probably not be recognized by either Amazon or Prime...For all the times l would use a printer, it is not feasible for me to buy one !!! l am looking for suggestions as there is no reason for me to keep the item in question...(DOESN"T FIT ME EITHER)..l will most certainly have to consider my online shopping with Amazon or Prime in the Future.. It was a convenient way for me to shop, due to my advanced age & capability of getting around physically...There are other companies for me to shop at, but l have had issues returning things to WISH, LITE INTHEBOX too far away in China, only once or twice but until NOW felt quite satisfied with both Amazon & Prime...Will never feel the same about ONLINE SHOPPING...

It's hard to know where to start because there is now so much wrong with this company's services.Having been an Amazon Prime customer for well over a decade I have seen a lot of changes but recently the service has gone downhill to the point that I will not be renewing my subscription when it next expires.Particular issues that I've experiences are:1. Fake products - There are now a large number of cheap/dangerous knockoff products on amazon and it is impossible to tell from the listings which are genuine and which are the fakes.2. Reviews - The review system is broken and now so full of fake and even fraudulent reviews it has lost all meaning. Basic tricks like aggregating reviews for several products or even switching reviews over to a completely different product are common and no attempt seems to be made to stop this practice.3. Prime Delivery - This increased significantly in price and whereas once next day delivery was the norm, the minimum I am now quoted is 3 to 5 days with most items not even despatching for a couple of days after the order - as bad as the free delivery for non-prime members. It is not unusual for items to take two to three weeks to arrive despite paying the Prime premium.I am also seeing a lot of instances where the item goes to "collected by courier" status very quickly preventing order cancellation but no further movement or valid training information appears for several days suggesting that the item has probably not actually been despatched and that status change was just to stop me cancelling when I discover the delay.4. Prime Video - This was always a bit of a rip-off with most items incurring an extra charge on top of prime membership but the latest change forces you to pay an extra subscription on top of the already expensive Prime membership to get the add free viewing I got for free up until now.5. Prime music - this is another service that has been deliberately made almost unusable unless you want to pay yet another addition subscription on top.6. Customer services - All contact is via chat or phone, not email, so hard to make formal complaints or keep a paper trail. Although occasionally helpful, most of the time they merely read information to you that you can already see on the website and promises of action are rarely followed through.I have, at one point or another raised all of these issues with Amazon customer services only to be met with responses that ranged from complete indifference to promises to pass on my concerns which clearly went no further because nothing changed.In short, other than the convenience of having so many items in one place there is little to commend this company any more. Amazon Prime in particular is most definitely no longer worth the money.

I give up!

When I signed up for prime, parcels got delivered on time and usually with a reliable delivery slot. Then, over time,  the delivery time occasionally changed to 'Today by 10PM'. Fair enough, sometimes things go wrong. But then this happened again and again to the point where it became standard practice. I don't work for Amazon and I didn't pay for Prime so that I could wait around for eight to ten hours a day until they could deign to provide the service I was paying them for. When I phoned up at 3pm on a friday (the same day as posting this review) to complain about it regarding an order which was marked as 'Out for delivery' since 9AM, instead of solving the problem, the agent on the phone said that "actually, that's in a queue and might not be there until Sunday". If that was the case, why was it showing as 'Out for delivery'? This combined with the reduction in selections to the point of being really quite pathetic on Amazon Fresh, and raising prices to cover the amount of money they have wasted on Prime Video just makes the company as a whole both complacent and arrogant to the point where they no longer deserve anybody's business. In fact, it got to the point where just dealing with Amazon literally just felt like being in an abusive relationship, which is why I cancelled my subscription. There is a popular phrase: 'fluff' around and find out.Amazon do the 'fluffing' around. Their customers do the finding out.

I‚Äôve written to Amazon‚Äôs CEO, Andy Jassy and his Executive Relations team on numerous occasions about Amazon‚Äôs breach of the Data Protection Act 2018 (DPA) and theft of its customer‚Äôs intellectual property.  I stated in an e-mail to Mr Jassy, among other things, that I‚Äôm complaining about Amazon‚Äôs unlawful delivery policy.Amazon UK Services Limited (Amazon) continues to breach the Data Protection Act 2018 (DPA) and is deliberately intruding on its customer's privacy and stealing their intellectual property by taking photos/images of their person and of their private property (location) without their express permission and Amazon is not transparent with how its processing, sharing and storing such data and is exacerbating its misconduct resorting to evasive tactics to avoid the issue, which is totally unacceptable.As far as I‚Äôm aware the conditions of purchase on all of my orders thus far, DID NOT include me having to give up my rights and allow Amazon to violate my privacy and take my intellectual property in exchange for delivering my parcels. If that were the case, I would certainly not have bought anything from Amazon. Amazon's fulfillment of contract is to simply deliver the parcels and ask for the recipient's name and signature which is legally sufficient for proof of delivery and which I would oblige if the drivers presented me with that option, but they don‚Äôt. They quickly snap a photo of you as soon as you open the door, drop the parcel off and walk away, even despite the large security notice on my front door clearly stating, "THIS IS PRIVATE PROPERTY, NO PHOTOS OR VIDEOS ALLOWED!"It is clear that Amazon needs to urgently address its delivery policy and give customers an option to sign for their deliveries and it must train its drivers to understand and respect PRIVATE PROPERTY and the right of privacy.Below, are some of the evasive tactics that Mr Jassy and team have responded following my Complaint and Request for ‚ÄúRight of Erasure‚Äù (SARs)[OPEN Quote] This is Jassy with Amazon's Executive Relations team.By corresponding with me, you have reached the highest level of customer service within our company. The Executive Relations' Department is the most senior department to which an issue may be escalated within Amazon.co.uk. This department liaises with customers on behalf of Amazon's most senior business executives, including the Amazon.co.uk Managing Director, the Amazon.co.uk Director of Customer Service, and our CEO.Your request was sent from an email address that is different from the one we have on file for you. I realise that you're concerned about deleting the photos or videos. It's never our intention to prolong this process, but in order to protect your privacy we can only send account information to the email address associated with your account. Please send this request from that email address.[END QUOTE]So according to his request I sent Mr Jassy my Complaint via the email associated with my Amazon account and this is the slippery response I received:[OPEN QUOTE]  ‚ÄúHello,This is Gaurab with Amazon Executive Relations.I'm sorry but I couldn't find an Amazon.co.uk account under the e-mail address from which you've written.[END QUOTE]Consequently, I sent Mr Jassy and team step-by-step screenshots of me logging into my Amazon account via the email associated with my account which Gaurab above claimed s/he could not find and this is the evasive response I received on that attempt:[OPEN QUOTE] Dear¬†Nicola,This is with Amazon's Executive Relations team.I was hoping to speak with you directly, on the number listed on your account, but unfortunately I was unable to reach you nor leave a voice message confirming my call.I hope you‚Äôll first accept my apologies for the frustration and inconvenience you‚Äôve experienced. [END QUOTE]These are many such examples of Amazon‚Äôs evasive tactics.I still haven‚Äôt received a satisfactory response from Amazon and as a result, I have no knowledge of how my personal data, photos/images are being processed, shared and stored as Amazon continues to arrogantly breach the Data Protection Act 2018.

You will be locked out of your Amazon account for supposed fraud by simply attempting to order any of their digital gift cards. Amazon is incapable of fulfilling these orders due to their failed ‚Äúverification system‚Äù and helpless customer service agents. Even at the supervisor level there‚Äôs no human being who can override the system upon confirming with you on the phone that you‚Äôre in fact placing the order rather than a scammer. Amazon gives the appearance of great customer service by allowing you to speak with agents directly‚Äîagents who are trained to be pleasant and patient but given no access to fix any real issues. The software truly runs the company. I spent more than 3 hours speaking with 3 different departments trying to get back into my account and re-placing my order over and over. After two days of this, my order was canceled by their system repeatedly, my account is still frozen for any kind of digital order, and a family member also got locked out immediately for the same purchase. By comparison, we were able to purchase the gift cards (barely in time for Christmas) at a physical retailer quickly and with zero aggravation. Amazon lost $300+ of sales to a brick-and-mortar because their software is abysmal and their customer service impotent. Appalling customer service.I have purchased from Amazon many many times and never had an issue. I was initially happy with the fast delivery date which was due to be 14 December. However despite the fact that Amazon claim to have attempted delivery in 14 December this attempt definitely didn‚Äôt not happen (I have an advanced security system which I had reviewed) when the chair eventually arrived with no notice in 18 December on a dark wet and windy evening it was left by my gate in the rain until I could get help to lift the very heavy boxes inside. Once inside it took hours to put the chair together with the poor and hard to follow instructions. Once installed it was apparent that the chair was of very poor quality and defective. I immediately reported the matter to amazon who quite frankly have been totally unhelpful. They have basically explained the item is from a ‚Äòthird party seller‚Äô which apparently means they don‚Äôt really care!! I have always believed that items bought on the Amazon platform gave me some kind of protection but this is definitely not the case. I am now still arguing with the ‚Äòthird party seller‚Äô with no help from Amazon. I have been informed that the seller sees no problem with the chair which quite frankly is alarming in itself. I have been told I need to return the chair in the original packaging (which I don‚Äôt Have as it arrived wet and damaged) and pay for a courier to collect it !! I have since discovered that previous reviews of the same chair are much of the same . Please read reviews before making any purchase these are often informative and an insight into the kind of company you are dealing with .

Amazon is the type of company that will offer an array of products from brands, but values money over ethics. They may seem friendly with their interface and show convenience through services. It's all a facade.However, that's a totally different story when it comes to communication and treatment towards employees.Reviews on the site are sometimes fake with scammers acting as sellers while authentic opinions are being suppressed. I noticed the number of bots frequenting there as well. Also users/buyers can find their reviews being removed and discover themselves being banned from contributing for "unusual reviewing activity" by Amazon.  The moderators really have poor judgement behind their monitors. Another example is when employees that opperate in warehouses experience awful working conditions, the bosses there give the employees little time for a break. If you're an employee that have a problem, your boss is not going to show any mercy for your mental anguish.Pathetically enough, workers resorted in using pee-pee bottles if they need to urinate instead of going to the bathroom.Workers in that environment usually breakdown mentally and become severely exhausted. The most ludicrous resolve Amazon has to offer was coping spaces in 2021. These are mental health booths known as "AmaZen."In the Summer of 2023, Amazon decided to lock one of its customers, Brandon Jackson of Baltimore, Maryland, from his home connected with the smart home devices because a delivery driver allegedly heard a derogatory term through his doorbell. This has made news in my country.Apparently, no one was home at the time as evident and Amazon finally granted access to the man's residence and his accounts without explanation.I'm not going to deal with a business that tries to control its customers in an abusive manner. I have pity for the workers who are delivery drivers and warehouse employees that have to endure such an unhealthy workplace. I share a better relationship with Ebay and Walmart customer services long before this! Ebay and Walmart are more ethical businesses I would use as a customer. I would not recommend Amazon.

I am compelled to share my disappointing experience with Amazon, specifically regarding an incident that occurred in August, which has left me frustrated and dissatisfied with their customer service.I made a substantial purchase exceeding $500, only to have the package left unattended on my front porch and subsequently stolen. Despite reporting the theft promptly, my attempts to seek assistance have been met with ongoing delays and unfulfilled promises from Amazon's customer support.This situation is deeply troubling, and as a valued customer, I expected a more proactive and helpful response. Unfortunately, despite providing all necessary details, including the order number and relevant documentation, the matter remains unresolved.The lack of responsibility and follow-up in the face of a significant financial loss is concerning. I believe that a reputable company like Amazon should take swift action and provide adequate support to customers who experience theft or loss.My hope is that by sharing my experience, it serves as a cautionary tale for others and prompts Amazon to reassess their commitment to customer satisfaction, especially in situations involving security issues with their deliveries.

BUYER BEWARE. As a Prime Member, Amazon did NOT make good on an order even though they didn't follow delivery instructions asked for at the time of order. As a result, and as a possible theft, Amazon did NOT provide a refund or replacement order even after completing every required step stated by reps. Beyond the financial loss, be aware most reps are hard to understand, don't listen, don't bother to refer to file notes (if there are any). They seem to use the same scripts not related to a question or to the information just provided. Example: I tried to explain the local police referred us to the Sheriff‚Äôs Office to file a possible theft report as they have the law enforcement jurisdiction at our rural address. No question or acknowledgement but repeatedly stating, ‚ÄúYou must file a police report.‚Äù Finally, when I asked to speak to a supervisor, the rep hung up!  Also, as in my case, you will never speak to the same rep again. Even after your claim reportedly goes to ‚Äúescalation,‚Äù you must call the general customer service number and start over, which includes reexplaining EVERYTHING as if it‚Äôs the first time you called.  Maddening! Still, I did EVERYTHING required, even repeatedly.  I was finally reassured by one phone rep that he saw my PDF report on file, that all had been done including talking to the USPS. He said our claim would be resolved quickly after he sent all to Escalation and not to worry about the deadline since we had completed everything required by that date. Yet on the ‚Äúdeadline date,‚Äù I called and spoke to 2 reps. I was told by the first rep after placing me on an extended hold, that he had called the police department and they had no record of a report from me on file, therefore there was nothing Amazon could do.  I again explained I had sent a PDF of a Sheriff‚Äôs Department report due to law enforcement jurisdiction as instructed by the local police department three times! He just repeated the same thing again with no acknowledgement of what I just said.  I begged him to listen and not hang up. I asked what "police" number he had called to verify he had called the Sheriff's Department; he said he couldn‚Äôt share that information due to privacy. I verbally stated the phone number of the Sheriff‚Äôs Department and asked if he had called that number - he wouldn't answer. I then asked to speak to his supervisor and was assured the supervisor would give me the same information he had. After an extended hold, someone new got on the phone. With a rude demeanor, he repeated that they had no police report on file; therefore, there would be no further support ‚Äì refund or reorder. When I insisted it was there, again explaining that the jurisdiction was with the Sheriff‚Äôs office, he stated it did not contain all the information required. With witness at my side, I asked repeatedly for him to provide specifics of what was not included as I had referred to their email requirements, emailed those requirements to the Sheriff's Department, and saw the report with my own eyes, confirming all requirements met. He would not answer my question and provided no details. Finally, he said it was an ‚Äúinitial report‚Äù and not a ‚Äúfinal report.‚Äù I told him this was the first I heard this as required to which he insisted they had provided me this information. Their email information had said to call Amazon during the police's office hours so their rep could verify information and I did this. (As soon as my call ended, I called the Sheriff‚Äôs Department myself and got immediately through. The gentleman in the report/records department told me no one from Amazon had called. They also said the rep doesn‚Äôt understand law enforcement investigations because if they don‚Äôt have a suspect as in my case, it is considered an open case with no final report written or available.) Bottomline: I have wasted significant time and effort ‚Äì for nothing. I‚Äôve taken a big financial loss on goods not delivered and paid at the same time a Prime Member fee to experience this type of treatment. (I also unfortunately ended up in the ER due to the stress of this all with heart issues.) Almost humorous, as you are on hold, Amazon‚Äôs recording speaks of their desire to have the best world class service. I am not a rude or unreasonable person. I used to be the Sr. V.P. in charge of customer service for a large company where we strived to protect the company but be fair with our customers. Trust me, Amazon's service is the worst. It‚Äôs inexcusable and I‚Äôm surprised there hasn‚Äôt been a class action lawsuit over inconsistent and unfair practices. Even if you‚Äôve heard positive things about Amazon or you haven't had a problem yourself, just wait. Your turn may be coming. And it may be a horrific experience like mine.

Every time I speak to an Amazon agent in chat, they always tell me they have to transfer me to the appropriate ‚Äòdepartment‚Äô which I‚Äôve come to learn is a total BS excuse for them to not have to do their job. I end up having to re-explain my situation to 3-5 agents per request.Usually, their English is horrible and they show zero desire to actually help you as the customer.If only this company didn‚Äôt have such a massive grip on the world, this level of standard would never be accepted for any new and rising company. They‚Äôd fail in a heartbeat because they treat their customers like literal trash.

On Sun, 24 Dec I received an email from Amazon saying, "We have temporarily placed your¬†Amazon¬†account on hold and canceled any pending orders or subscriptions because we detected unusual activity on it. To restore access to your account, sign in and follow on-screen instructions."I signed in and followed the instructions to the letter. Yet on Mon, 25 Dec, I received another email from Amazon saying, "We have closed your¬†Amazon¬†account because we were not able to confirm that you are authorized to use the payment method associated with your account. Your pending orders have been canceled. If you believe this is a mistake, please contact Customer Service."I tried tweeting them only to be told by their support on Twitter that I must reply to the email about my account being close. I told them it came from a "no-reply" address so I could not reply to it. Their support person said I could reply to it.Yet when I did reply to it, I got an email back saying, "You've written to an address that does not accept incoming e-mails, but we have provided links to help answer some common questions.", and that I must try the links on their Help page. All those links require a login, but they have closed my account, so I can't log in.I finally managed to find a button on an Amazon page that let me chat to an associate. He kept me waiting 20 minutes, asked me to wait longer, then closed the chat without any answers.

Two items that I ordered on Amazon were never delivered, and when I look at the order status on Amazon, it says "Your package may be lost."  This has happened a number of times with other orders.  I called Customer Service to get my lost items replaced, and I spoke with a rep who was nice and polite, but I simply could not understand what she was saying to me.  I had to ask her to repeat what she was saying many, many times, and when she did, I often still could not understand her.  I realize that providing overseas customer support has financial advantages for Amazon, but it is at the expense of customers.  On almost every customer service call I have made to Amazon, I have had a great deal of trouble communicating with the rep.  And I have often received information that is completely incorrect.  I remember when Customer Service reps were based in the U.S., and they were great and I was able to communicate with them.  My heart sinks every time I have to call Customer Service and I hear someone answer with a heavy accent because I know the interaction is going to be difficult and stressful.  I love  Amazon because of their huge and varied inventory and the ease of ordering from them, but I hate their Customer Service and Amazon delivery services.  Before Amazon created their own delivery service and delivery was handled by Fedex and UPS and a few others, I never had a problem with delivery.  But now I've had multiple problems, with my items being delivered to the wrong address (when my address is clearly posted on my house), with my items not being delivered at all but being "lost," and with my items being delivered late.  I miss the old Amazon and have definite mixed feelings about the current one.

Christmas Disappointment ‚Äì Missing DJI Camera BundleI recently received my parcel, or so I thought. The delivery man left it on the floor and requested I enter a code on his phone. Suspicion arose when the weight felt off, and upon opening it, I discovered baby items instead of the expensive DJI camera bundle set I ordered. The disappointment prompted an immediate call to Amazon customer service, as evident in the attached photo.Despite the tracking indicating a delivery on my street for five hours on 21.12.23, the package mysteriously arrived on 22.12.23. During the redelivery, the delivery person, with limited English proficiency, placed the parcel on the floor and asked me to enter a code on his phone‚Äîraising further concerns about the legitimacy of the process.The evident scan became apparent when I noticed the packaging opened too easily, contrary to Amazon's usual tamper-proof measures. This ordeal is especially disheartening as I cannot have children, and the unexpected delivery of baby items shattered my Christmas spirit. The mix-up not only ruined the holiday but also raised questions about the security of Amazon's delivery system. I hope for a swift resolution to rectify this unfortunate situation.

There is absolutely no reasonable way to contact Amazon to make a complaint about a blatant lie by one of their delivery drivers. So I'm putting the details here which is the only website that seems to allow me to do so. A note on my Amazon account, presumably from the Amazon delivery driver, says: "Your package was delivered to a neighbour James at door H Signed by: James."This is a blatant lie. This is a small block of 8 flats, and there is only one James in the block, and that would be me. The delivery driver is a liar. This is what actually happened.The package was left outside the main security doors where anyone passing by or visiting another tenant could easily have stolen it. Fortunately, it was noticed by a neighbour who brought it to my door. Whilst I had asked for the package to be delivered to my neighbour, I was at home all day. A simple push of either MY bell or my neighbour's, would have got an answer. Instead, the package was left outside the security doors at the front of the building and the driver who delivered it lied about it. As an aside, I ordered something else at the same time as the item above and it was supposed to arrive yesterday. I still haven't got it at the time of writing this review. I will never buy from Amazon again. IMO, the customer service is abysmal. The chatbox 'assistant' (I use the word advisedly) is ludicrous. You simply go round and round in circles and never get to make the comment/s you want to make in the first place. There is simply no way to write a complaint to Amazon itself - except in spaces like this. So thank you Amazon for nothing and for wasting my time.

Amazon customer service has plummeted over the past year or so.  Now they are making returns harder and charging if you use UPS.  They are also requiring a copy of your ID which is unacceptable!! They claim they need to identify us but they don't seem to need that to take our money!!  That is invasive and opens us up to identity theft in the event they get hacked like everyone else.  I will never give them this!!!  To make matters worse any phone call to customer service takes far too long.  Now, after you've spent 10-15 minutes with a customer service rep they often say they need to transfer the call and you sit in yet another long queue waiting for that person to help and they are less inclined to resolve problem easily putting the burden on the customer.I recently ordered 2 gallons of fuel stabilizer.  After multiple emails that it had been delayed, I called to cancel the order because I was leaving town.  They said they couldn't, but as soon as they could locate te product they would refund my money.  Then, I got emails saying the product "was likely delivered on December 2nd", when it wasn't.  They still would not refund my money.  They said I had to wait until after December 12th - almost 2 weeks and I would have to call back and go thru the process all over again.  Finally, after 4 phone calls and over 2 hours of wasted  time, they refunded my money for "their" mistake.  Yesterday, I received a $16 item that was not as described online and they wanted a copy of my drivers license or ID.  Well I told them to take a hike.  Instead of placing my next order on Amazon I bought several hundred dollars worth of goods between Walmart and Home Depot and even saved money!!  I will be cancelling Prime and using Amazon as little as possible in the future.

Buyer bewareDO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON,  I purchased a bunch of items from Amazon and  when I went to open the undamaged , not tampered box, which looked exactly like the picture taken by the delivery personnel and what was attached on my Amazon order saying delivered . When I called back after work the lovely lady listened to my story and tried to call the police department at that time but because it was after 6pm the police department was no longer open . They had since 10 am in the morning to call but no Amazon customer service rep called and now I have to wait over the weekend . They don‚Äôt have a picture of the package inside before it left Amazon but a picture of the package/box on my porch from the delivery personel , which looks exactly how it was when I received it .I will not be purchasing anymore from Amazon ‚Ä¶ I received all my products that were suppose to be in my package except for one item and I am the one that has to do all the work and file a police report for something I believe was not stolen . I am glad that I am able to write a review for Amazon, the hardest part is finding the correct Amazon (with me living in the UK), and a search for Amazon revealed pages and pages of Amazons', all linked, with different country extensions etc.Anyway, despite the negative feedback, and there seems to be an awful lot here, PLUS, despite the feedback about what goes on in the background, I have to say I am delighted with Amazon. Truly, they have never let me down, deliver ALWAYS on time, keep me updated all the way too, and so easy if a return is needed.I see our Amazon drivers every day struggling in this constant traffic, literally stood still at times on motorways and peak time, and yet they still raise a smile, and deliver all the goods to the correct place even following any instructions for safe places.This Christmas 2023, (at the time of the review), they will be busier than ever, and yet they still deliver, even up to 10pm at night.  Hats off to Amazon, and I just hope the odd good review now and then will help others think, again, how hard this company are working to get this right, and on time.

"Arrive tonight by 10pmÔºÇis a myth. No matter what the website says or the countdown timer says - just forget about receiving it the same day. I have yet to ever receive an order the same day after selecting that option umpteen times. Amazon may as well remove this option since it's an out and out lie.When I rang up to find out more, I was told "well, you ordered it this morning so it's going to be next-day delivery.' Tried to convince me that I didn't see the words 'ARRIVE TONIGHT BY 10PM' as I hit order. I didn't select next day delivery as I knew I wouldn't be available.Frustrating experience - don't get your hopes up with that is all I can say on that.The couriers are hopeless. They rarely knock and will happily leave your parcel out on the street. When they do knock, they expect you to instantly teleport to the door, seeing as they give you a nanosecond to open the door after ringing your doorbell. If you take any longer than that, they'll drop your parcel on the floor and take off down the street.

I ordered an IPad Air from Amazon (the company itself rather than a Marketplace seller) on 24th November. It was meant to be my daughter‚Äôs Christmas present and it cost several hundred pounds. It should have been delivered to me on 26th November, though instead I was delivered a box of opened dry cat food. I presume that an Amazon employee somewhere along the chain took the IPad and replaced it with the cat food that they emptied to an equivalent weight.I phoned Amazon Customer Services on 26th November and explained what had happened. I asked I be sent an actual IPad Air, though was told I could only be refunded the money, and only once Amazon had ‚Äúreceived my return‚Äù (the cat food). UPS collected the cat food from me on 27th and delivered it to Amazon on 28th November.Two and a half weeks and several phone calls to Amazon down the line I was told today that ‚Äúhopefully‚Äù I should be refunded my money on 3rd January 2024 (38 days after I‚Äôd initially explained to Amazon what had happened and ‚Äúreturned‚Äù the item).Each Amazon Customer Services person over the past couple of weeks has treated me indifferently, as if I‚Äôm a customer who has returned an unwanted book rather than someone who has essentially been defrauded by an Amazon employee. In actual fact I‚Äôve been treated worse than someone returning an unwanted book, as if it had been a low cost item that was being refunded I would have been reimbursed within 14 days, rather than it taking more than a month because of the financial cost involved. I have kept on being told to ‚Äúbe patient‚Äù and that I‚Äôll be refunded in 5 to 10 days, though the date keeps being put back for no reason that anyone has explained, and now for some reason I won‚Äôt be refunded until 2024. It means my daughter will be without a Christmas present this year. No one at Amazon seems particularly bothered or sympathetic.I might continue to buy inexpensive items from Amazon that I can‚Äôt easily get elsewhere, though I certainly won‚Äôt be buying anything expensive from them again. Though buying from Amazon is often convenient, it is much safer to shop with a retailer with decent, accessible and relatively transparent Customer Services.

On 14/05/2023 I ordered an e-gift card for US$100 to be sent to an email address of a family member in the USA. The corresponding 95 euros was debited to my Amazon.fr account. No problem. The e-gift card was not delivered but after extensive tracing I established that the amount of 95euros was in actual fact deposited into the recipients Amazon.com account. Euros cannot be used for purchases on Amazon in the USA. It has been impossible to obtain a refund or to open the account section containing the 95 euros. Amazon have referred me to Amazon.fr, Amazon.uk, Amazon.es. All not interested. The 95 euros is now frozen in an Amazon.com account and nobody at Amazon is interested in assisting me to resolve the problem. I have to warn prospective users of e-gift cards to be aware of the difficulties and waste of time I am encountering.

Four months ago I bought 2 bike tires from Amazon.  I returned both tires in the same box because they were the wrong size for my bike.  A month after they received the tires, Amazon sent me an email saying they were going to charge my account for 1 of the tires because they didn't receive it, even though it was together in the box with the other one that they received.  I called customer service and they assured me that it was an error and they have both tires so they will not charge my account.  Then 4 months later I get another email from them saying that they again do not have the tires, and that they will be changing my account.  So I called them twice, and they assured me that this was sent out in error and they will not charge my account.  A week later they ended up charging my credit card.  I called them again, and now waiting for a refund.  I also called my credit card, and they said that if I don't get a refund with 5 business days, they will dispute the charges, and refund my account, and will cancel my credit card, and give me a new one so that Amazon can't keep doing this to me.  After this poor experience, I am going to stop shopping at Amazon because this is a waste of my time to deal with this crap from them just because they want to make a profit.

I would give it a 0/5 star rating if I could as their Accessibility, ease of use and neurodiverse options are limited when you ask for help for Prime Video. It is very confusing to have to click a whole bunch of tabs and then find out they don't have a message box or email address. Amazon also has no formal complaint process that is easy to find. False advertising that you can email them. I went through every drop-down bar, and not once did the email light up. I did not want people contact today as it is my day to watch series or read my ebooks and wanted to report a strange IT glitch by email/message that I felt confused me and didn't really fit any of their drop down bars. Not Amazon Video, Kindle or main website provide help message boxes or email addresses. You only have the option to speak on chat and mobile. The help page takes 5-8 clicks. You type in Binge contact us and their email address is easy to find in Google. Paramount has their easy to access email address on their international website, Everand has I think either easy to find email address through google search or a message box. Use these websites. They have more user-friendly, easy help service for streaming, ebooks and audibles.

I don't have personal experiences or opinions. However, I can provide information about Amazon. It is a multinational technology and e-commerce company based in Seattle, Washington. Founded by Jeff Bezos in 1994, Amazon started as an online bookstore and has since expanded into various product categories, including electronics, apparel, and cloud computing services through Amazon Web Services (AWS). The company is known for its customer-centric approach, vast product selection, and innovative services like Amazon Prime. If you have specific questions about Amazon, feel free to ask!

After ANOTHER THIRTY MINUTES, the "gift card specialist" said she can't process that many codes for gift cards so she has to transfer me to a "gift card specialist." I sold for Amazon for quite some time, until I was told I sold counterfeit merchandise. I sought to ask Amazon for verification which never came, no client ever complained as my suppliers were all certified. Amazon refused to send me a copy of the complaint from the company that I was a reseller associate of. Turns out the complaint was lodged by another associate but didn't matter to Amazon. They just wanted independent suppliers out. Then worst of it was they held on to $2800 of my money. Pity no negative stars can be given, they certainly deserve it. Customers don't know how badly the sellers are treated, this is just the tip of the many icebergs.
